Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for a Data Analyst to support our growing Regional team here in Singapore, as part of an international team of highly talented and motivated people. To thrive in this role, you will need the technical expertise to navigate a complex and ever-changing data infrastructure as well as the ability to communicate effectively and persuasively to a non-technical audience.
What you will love doing:
Work within with the newly formed regional data team (data analysts, data engineers, machine learning engineers) as well as key business stakeholders to deliver insights, reports, visualization, analysis and predictive models
Perform ad-hoc analyses to support cross functional projects, working closely with the global leadership team
Define, implement, monitor business KPIs, provide data driven insight to the business
Who you are:
2-4 years experience in data analytics / business intelligence
Strong oral and written communication skills
Strong business mindset and ability to grasp business requirements from stakeholders
Champion of data and visualization with strong presentation and story-telling skills
Ability to write clean, structured, and high performance SQL code
Knowledge and experienced with BI tools (Tableau, Data Studio) is a plus
Knowledge with big data, Data Warehouse technologies, Python or R, is a plus

Roles & Responsibilities
Who are We Looking For
We are seeking a Data Analyst with a proven track record of delivering impact and value to business through insights. Your work will influence business decisions that will drive the operations, customer engagement, stakeholder management and asset management of the organization across a wide range of industries and business use cases. You will work towards promoting and enabling a data-centric approach among internal stakeholders and ensure the proper metrics are being used in tracking and improving key business parameters. This role requires an inquisitive individual with an eye for detail and passion for numbers and how they influence business decisions. It is also important for you to have strong communication and collaborative skills in engaging stakeholders and be able to solve their pain points through the data insights you provide.
What will You Do
· Collaborate with stakeholders to obtain a clear understanding of their business pain points and develop the appropriate data products to support their business decisions
· Collate available data sources and evaluate definitions and limitations, before implementing ETL processes to build the relevant datasets
· Design and build data products and dashboards to enable stakeholders to visualize data insights, and train them to be able to derive the answers they seek themselves
· Define and create processes to ensure stakeholders can efficiently track key metrics on a regular frequency, depending on the business use case
· Work closely with technology vendors to develop and refine data products and coordinate with internal teams to enhance the quality and richness of the data lake
What will You Bring
· 2 to 5 years of experience in data analyst role, with a bachelor’s degree specialising in business analytics, preferably in a large organization with business units operating across different industries
· Proficient in data analytics tools, and possesses plenty of hands-on experience with data visualisation products
· Track record of delivering data products that cater to stakeholder requirements and making sure analysis and reports are fit for purpose
· Strong communication skills with the ability to articulate complex concepts in a simple and succinct manner
· Critical thinker and a creative problem solver; able to evaluate a problem across different facets and develop solutions that work
· Meticulous and conscientious in your approach to work, delivering high quality work that is error free
· Excellent time management and task prioritisation skills

Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking for a data analyst with superior analytical, SQL & Excel abilities to join the Strategy & Planning team at Daraz. The right candidate will have excellent technical, problem-solving and communication skills, and be able to find practical solutions to complex problems.
You should be able to thrive in a fast-paced environment and be ready to immerse yourself into your work. This is an exciting opportunity to join a unique team, in a fast-growing multinational company.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
· Extract, deep-dive into, & manipulate large sets of data organized, in a well-structured data warehouse designed for exploration and functionality
· Use your problem-solving and critical thinking skills to identify trends, conduct root cause analyses, and generate high-impact, ad-hoc analyses.
· Build, maintain and produce reports and dashboards that give key insights to colleagues from all departments at Daraz, including senior management
· Work with the S&P manager and different teams across the company to innovate and implement tools to drive business performance improvement and cost efficiencies
· Develop detailed targets, forecasts, and business models so that strategic and business targets are met
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
· BSc degree from a top university in a quantitative subject - a background in business intelligence, data science, mathematics, economics, quantitative finance, computer science or engineering preferred
· At least 1 year of data analytics experience
· Go-getter attitude, willing to immerse themselves in the business, with a proactive approach to getting things done
· Superior organizational skills to manage multiple priorities, and the flexibility to adapt to changing scope and evolving business requirements
· Outstanding analytical, problem solving, and organizational skills to manage priorities with tight deadlines without compromising quality
· Excellent verbal and written communication skills; fluent in English
· Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel and proficiency in SQL are essential
· Experience configuring data visualization tools such as PowerBI, Tableau or Qlikview is required
· Prior experience working with large sets of data is strongly preferred
· Prior experience working with automation tools such as Python or macros, is preferred
· Prior experience with data warehouses, data cubes, and reporting dashboard is preferred

Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description:
Leading through example: Overseeing high performing, multidisciplinary members of the Data & Analytics team, you will design and build complex visualisations and analytical models to understand the impact of various market or operational changes to our business.
You will work closely with the operational and functional areas to identify, prioritise and deliver on their most pressing and impactful analytical use case; turning complex findings into simple visualisations and recommendations for execution.
Analyze and interpret large (PB-scale) volumes of transactional, operational and customer data using proprietary and open source data tools, platforms and analytical tool kits.
Be part of a fast-paced industry and organisation where time to market is critical.

Requirements:
A degree in a quantitative discipline, as Mathematics, Statistics, Actuarial Sciences, Computer Science, Engineering or Life Sciences.
Minimum 5 - 8 years of industry experience applying advanced analytics.
Demonstrated experience in the application of analytical techniques to guide operational improvements, scheduling, asset utilisation or investment decisions; and of supervising the work of others, preferably analytics or engineering roles.
A desire and ability to think abstractly, solve problems and deal with ambiguity.
Enthusiasm and drive to be a leader in our team, helping shape and develop its future.
Strong communication, presentation, project management and time management skills.
Advanced competency in two or more of the following:
Analytical software (e.g. R, SAS);
Data visualisation tools (e.g. Qlikview, Tableau, PowerBI,);
A relational or graph database management tool (e.g. SQL, NoSQL, Neo4J);
Programming. (e.g. VBA, C++, Java, Python).

Roles & Responsibilities
The Financial Markets (FM) Data Management team is looking for a candidate to fill the role of Senior Business Analyst. The successful candidate will be part of the data management team, providing.
· a simple & scalable data architecture, minimising inefficiencies, and costs for the CIO
· a pool of SME resources for defining data requirements, optimal solution design and facilitating delivery for SCB’s Programmes and Projects
· a simplified engagement model for programmes, data managers and consumers

Key Roles & Responsibilities
· Work with stakeholders across business and technology to elicit, clarify, translate, and simplify data requirements.
· Provide solution design support for data provision and consumption.
· Establish best practice and govern data management.
· Co-ordinate and support development and testing work related to data requirements.
· Provide business cases and insights into opportunities for cost and control improvements related to data provision and consumption.
Qualifications & Skills
· Excellent verbal communication skills; facilitating working meetings, building credibility and trust with stakeholders, negotiating contentious issues with stakeholders and escalating issues as promptly.
· Excellent business documenting skills, able to convey complex information with objectivity and brevity.
· Critical thinking and problem solving; architecting and explaining multiple solutions, assessing relative strengths and weaknesses, and justifying solutions for approval.
· Strong Financial Markets / Investment Bank experience; able to analyse business problems and design operating models producing process flow diagrams, and risk assessments.
· Experienced in understanding and explaining information level issues, utilising architecture diagrams, entity relationship diagrams, data dictionaries & maps.
· Capable of working with large datasets, familiar with data profiling, basic SQL.
· Self-motivated and able to work independently.
· Familiar with data quality management framework
· Technical understanding of xml, fmpl, data and data models
· Some technical experience with development and / or database design and management
· Familiar with agile methodologies for project delivery
· Understanding of modern databases technologies and familiar with programming languages used for data management and analysis (e.g., python)

company: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY HEALTH SYSTEM PTE. LTD.
job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview

We are living in thrilling times. Technology is reshaping how we live and we want to use it to redefine how healthcare services are offered. Alexandra Hospital being one of the oldest hospitals in Singapore is at the forefront of the healthcare redesign and innovation. The hospital is undergoing massive campus redevelopment, piloting new model of care, building and testing new ideas and innovation with the latest technology. We want to build a strong data analytics team with the right foundation - using data, technology and trust to solve problems and serve our patients.
Heath Informatics and Data Analytics Department works on some of the most challenging and fascinating problems in healthcare. We apply latest data analytics techniques, machine learning, simulation, modelling, forecasting, scheduling, optimization, and many other advanced techniques on our huge datasets to push our service metrics to their bounds, directly and indirectly. We foster a culture where we enjoy raising the bar constantly for ourselves and others, and that strongly supports the freedom to explore and innovate.

Job Responsibilities

Develop a roadmap for data analytics for the hospital to partner with the various stakeholders
Explore and extract insights from massive healthcare dataset, to power a new care model that can make our care delivery seamless, precise and in fairness to each patient
Build models to test the new model of care based on alternative data
Leveraging data to help the operation users to answer questions around service expansion, care delivery, patient retention/churn and any other business goals that can be addressed through data insights.
Build, validate, test, and deploy machine learning or other data science models to predict and influence the behaviour of patients and providers with the goal of optimising system efficiency
Work independently or in a team to solve complex problem statements
Interface with business & operation teams to formulate solutions and influence changes informed by your finding
Requirements
Masters’ Degree or Bachelors’ Degree in Operation Research/Management, Mathematics, Computer Science/Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Business Analytics, Information System, Physics or other quantitative disciplines.
Ability to work with multi-disciplinary teams, collaborative, accommodative and supportive to contribute to the shared vision and common goal.
Min. 2-3 years of hands-on experience in data mining, machine learning modelling (natural language processing, regression, time-series etc), predictive analytics and big data analytics. Fresh graduate will also be considered based on merit.
Knowledge & experience in advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.)
Proficiency with data science and analytics tools will be plus (Such as R, python, SPSS, Excel, Tableau)
Prior experience in health services is added advantage, but not a must.
Good understanding of database and ETL techniques and tools (such as SQL, OBIEE etc)
Strong written and oral communication skills

Roles & Responsibilities

Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities:
Conduct and support digital forensic analysis and data collection
Review, analyze, and alert on DLP activity logs.
Combine and bring context to the combination of various log sources and forensic analysis.
Use and improve upon existing technologies and workflows to accurately and efficiently identify risk based on multiple data sets and data points (e.g., person, location, activity).
Designing, developing and testing data analysis/collection and visualization applications in programming language(s) of choice.
Conducting digital forensic disk imaging and maintaining chain of custody when needed to support investigations and legal requirements.
Requirements:
Degree in Digital, Computer Forensics or related with 3-5 years of relevant experience
Ability to communicate fluently with Mandarin-speaking vendors and authorities is vital to identify and investigate risk in the region
Adhere to digital forensic principals, methodology, and protocols to include evidence handling and preservation
Maintain awareness and follow data handling, safety, and security policy and procedures
Strong understanding and practical knowledge of operating system design, computer networking (transport and application layer), network protocols, and computer file systems
Good communication, interpersonal and team coordination skills
Ability to lift, move, open, disassemble and assemble up to 50 pounds in weight of computers, laptops, servers, and other computing devices.
Self-sufficient, motivated individual with the ability to calmly operate in high stress environment to meet goals in a timely manner.
Interested applicants can send their resume on deepti@uniconnect.com.sg stating their current/expected salary along with their availability.

Roles & Responsibilities
Accredify is a well-funded Singapore based trust-tech start-up with presence in Malaysia, Myanmar, Japan and Vietnam. We help organisations turn physical documents into verifiable and tamper-proof documents by leveraging on distributed ledger technology. We are a fast-growing start-up with a work-hard/play-hard culture. If you would like to join our young and dynamic team, apply for this opportunity today!

In Education, we help higher education institutions issue tamper-proof digital degree certificates and transcripts. The firm is currently present in 5 countries and expanding their solution across the globe. In 2020, we were recognised as one of the Top 50 Southeast Asia EdTech firms by HolonIQ.

In Healthcare, Accredify is a government-authorised service provider that helps healthcare institutions issue HealthCerts, a template for digital verifiable COVID-19 swab results which Accredify helped to co-develop and is currently being issued by all clinics in Singapore. Accredify has 500 partner clinics in Singapore and Hong Kong.

To find out more: https://accredify.io

Roles & Responsibilities
COMPANY DESCRIPTION
Ascentis is the leader in powering CRM & Loyalty programs for leading brands in Singapore and the region. Our clients benefit from our suite of cutting edge solutions in CRM, Omni-channel Loyalty, Integrated Retail eCommerce, Business Intelligence, Mobile Engagement, and Digital Marketing Services. Voted by senior industry marketers as one of Singapore's award-winning loyalty marketing agency, Ascentis is proud to be leading the customer engagement innovation in the retail, food & beverage, entertainment, and hospitality industries. We are a young spirited company with a culture of innovation. Our teams are driven by experience and passion. We are agile and passionate in what we do. We believe in our people. We believe in ourselves. Our clients believe in us. 
As we continue to scale, we are interested to seek dynamic individual and self-starter to join us on an amazing journey by building great products for clients who believe in us.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Build data pipelines (ETL/ELT flows) to retrieve data from various data sources and put them together in a data lake and data warehouse
Build data quality service to ensure the integrity of the data models
Build dashboards using AWS Quicksight
Implement monitoring tools/scripts to identify performance bottlenecks
Optimize data extraction operations so that it does not impede performance of source systems as well as improving the overall performance ETL/ELT jobs
Producing high-quality code
Collaborate with Engineering & Product management team
May be required to work with external partners or clients in building the data pipelines
QUALIFICATIONS
5+ years experience designing and implementing data processing solutions at scale
BSc in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience
Practical experience designing and implementing with AWS Analytics services, especially Glue, Athena, Lambda, Macie, SageMaker and Quicksight

Practical experience building ETL/ELT data pipelines and best practices around it, such as on data cleansing, data tokenisation and ensuring good data quality
Experience in data visualization tool such as AWS Quicksight
Familiarity with databases such as SQL Server and PostgreSQL will be advantageous
Practical working experience using Python
Experience in team leading will be advantageous
At least intermediate level in spoken and written English
Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - Ascentis Pte Ltd

This position is responsible for the successful design and delivery of reports and visualisation. The analyst will perform the necessary data manipulations and present meaningful business insights. This position supports the Data Management Manager in project delivery, and the Data Team in operations.
Responsibilities:
End-to-end experience in dashboard development.
Gather business requirements, design dashboard UI, create BRD and lead development of dashboards.
Collaborate with cross functional teams comprised of end users, management, and vendors.
Provide exploratory and diagnostic analysis to resolve complex business queries for area of responsibility.
Monitor and improve adoption of data analysis and visualisation tools in all business units by providing end user trainings and engagement.
Establish and maintain operational workflow and processes for data and analytics platform.
Work closely with Data Management Lead and Data Architect / Data Engineer to ensure solutions are continually improved to synchronise with business processes.
Adapt to new data technologies in the industry and plan for continuous integration and upgrade of the existing solutions.
Drive the organization-wide data literacy training programme to upskill the workforce to be data-savvy and data- driven in business decisions.
Competencies:
Designing and maintaining major data visualisations and reporting technologies.
Working with major data related technologies, such as ETL, Databases, and Business Intelligence
Developing projects in Tableau platform and SAP Cloud Platform (Full-stack WebIDE, HANA-as-a-service, Smart Data Integration).
Good business understanding to convey business requirements to technical specifications
Strong understanding and hands-on experience with data preparation, staging, management, and analytics.
Strong aptitude for numbers and comfortable handling large volumes of data.
Strong understanding of data modelling, workflow, and processes.
Documentation of processes, analytics design, measure definitions, data integration, and development.
Good team player and process driven.
Good verbal and written communication skills.

Non-Mature Mid-Career Individuals: $3,000
Mature Mid-Career Individuals: $2,800

This position is open to recent graduates and mid-career individuals (mature and non-mature).
Graduates interested in this position should possess a Bachelor's Degree.

Roles & Responsibilities
This role reports to the Regional Head of working Capital and is supervised by senior members of the Matter Finance Data team and is part of a growing team that optimises client experience by building and evolving world class capabilities for engaging new clients and opening new matters. The role is based in our Singapore office and will cover activity in our APAC offices (Australia, Hong Kong, Singapore and China).
This role is ideal for a well organised candidate with a strong attention to detail who also understands the importance of the role in our commercial success. They should be comfortable communicating with people at all levels of the firm and collaborating across various cultural backgrounds.

Key responsibilities
· Managing the matter finance data checks for all APAC offices, including:
o Daily review of new matters
o Management of shared mailbox
o Communication with front office to resolve queries related to the matter opening process
o Maintain log of common issues resolved
o Review ‘out of scope’ matters on a weekly basis

· Identifying and resolving/escalating any risks supported by suggestions what could be done to avoid or mitigate the risk, including:
o Regular meetings with the other members of the Matter Finance Data team to share issues and discuss solutions
o Updating process documents relating to:
o Practice Group Mapping
o Section & Department Mapping
o Common Payors
o Key Clients
o Standard Rates
o Billing Arrangements
o Billing Frequencies

· Building and maintaining effective relationships with Partners and the Practices across the region.

· Collaborating effectively with colleagues within the practice as well as other finance and business support teams

Candidate profile
• A minimum 1 years' experience, at least one of the following:
o legal services finance, e.g. opening legal matters or billing
o an operational role with a demonstrable track record of consistent delivery, continuous improvement and problem solving
o insurance claims

• Highly motivated with a positive, 'can do' attitude

• Committed to quality and attention to detail

• Clear, concise written and verbal communicator

• Comfortable working in a high volume, fast paced environment

• Fast learner of new technology, strong excel and proficient in other Microsoft Office applications

• Demonstrated teamwork and collaboration skills, as well as the ability to work independently

• Knowledge of Thomson Reuters Elite 3E would be advantageous but not essential

• Written/verbal mandarin would be advantageous but not essential

About Clyde & Co in the Asia Pacific Region
A pragmatic and dynamic international law firm with a focus on core sectors of infrastructure, insurance, international trade, natural resources and transportation. Clyde & Co is recognised for its work in and with fast-moving and volatile emerging markets, and for a history of managing complex, multi-jurisdictional transactions and disputes. Internationally, with more than 4,000 staff across six continents, we are on the front line for our clients' interests, all over the world. Our culture is one that is based on our integrity, enjoyment of work and a spirit of adventure that runs through everything we do. Clyde & Co is a truly entrepreneurial firm, always seeking new opportunities. We have had a presence in the Asia Pacific region for close to 40 years, during which time we have invested in building a network of market leading specialists who support our clients' international and regional growth strategies. We have over 500 directly-employed staff in-region. Our regional network includes presence in: Hong Kong, Shanghai, Beijing, Chongqing, Ulaanbaatar, New Delhi, Kuala Lumpur, Singapore, Auckland, Sydney, Brisbane, Melbourne and Perth, as well as working closely with Clyde & Co offices around the world.
For more about the firm, its lawyers, offices and areas of expertise and for the latest industry thought leadership please visit www.clydeco.com

How to apply
This is a fantastic opportunity to become part of a dynamic and progressive firm. If you are interested in this position, please submit your application (including cover letter and resume) via the link below.
If you would like further information or a confidential chat please contact Vivienne Micheletti vivienne.micheletti@clydeco.com

company: CAMBRIDGE CENTRE FOR ADVANCED RESEARCH AND EDUCATION IN SINGAPORE LTD.
job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Who are we?
We are the University of Cambridge’s presence in Singapore, Cambridge CARES. Our activities are sponsored by the National Research Foundation’s CREATE programme. Our first research programme, Cambridge Centre for Carbon Reduction in Chemical Technology (C4T), is a collaboration between University of Cambridge, Nanyang Technological University and National University of Singapore.
Our team is comprised of world-class scientists and engineers working in a vibrant, fast-paced environment with great opportunities for knowledge and skills development.

Who are we looking for?
We are looking for a talented and creative Data Visualisation Analyst to support the J-Park Simulator (JPS) Project for data visualisation. The candidate should be specialised in creating stunning interactive feature with the various sources of data and models.
The JPS project aims at a comprehensive virtualisation of industrial operations, i.e. a hierarchical representation of data and models associated with every entity in an industrial park, in order to exploit synergies for resource, energy, and emissions savings. The overall goal is, using ideas from the Semantic Web, Internet of Things, Industry 4.0, machine learning, artificial intelligence, and statistics, to create an integrated simulation platform and expert system capable of providing quantitative decision support.

The successful candidate will be expected to:
Develop our main software tool (JPS). This will involve keeping abreast of the latest web technologies, making key design decisions, and ensuring their realisation
Support the development of analytics solutions by conceptualising, designing, developing, documenting and maintaining high-impact visuals that express insights or complex scenarios in intuitive ways
Collaborate with team to understand needs for actionable insights
Architect efficient 2D and 3D User Interface system
Build a data model of entities which makes use of a geographical information system (GIS)
Designing and developing executable programs and browser based applications
Identify, evaluate new technologies and resolve performance and scalability issues
Communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Participate in research discussions with local industries and partners, overseas universities, and writing reports
Write conference / journal papers and reports
What skills will you need?
A good degree in Computer Science, Information Technology and Computer Engineering
Knowledge of tools such as Unity, Unreal, object-oriented programming languages (Java), scripting languages (Python), IDEs (NetBeans, Eclipse), Protégé, TBC and Chrome developer tools
Experience in UX design, CSS, WebGL, shader programming, NodeJS, gaming industry/software engineering/web development using C++/Java, as well as JavaScript/PHP, etc
Some understanding of relational and non-relational database management systems, semantic web and ontologies, HTTP protocol, APIs and data exchange formats such as XHL and JSON (an advantage)
Mathematical and statistical skills, with experience in algorithm and methods development (an advantage)
The ability to publish conference/journal papers
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to work as part of a dynamic, multidisciplinary team of researchers
What can we offer you?
A stimulating working environment with friendly, highly motivated colleagues
A competitive salary in line with your skills and experience
A one-year contract in the first instance, extendable following a satisfactory performance
Comprehensive medical insurance coverage as part of your employment
Employment under a Research Collaboration Agreement between CARES and Nanyang Technological University (NTU)
Please note that this post is based in Singapore.
To apply, please send your CV and cover letter (summarising the most relevant skills and experience that you have for the position) to recruitment@cares.cam.ac.uk.

Roles & Responsibilities
Chief Data Scientist (Two open positions)

Job Description:

H2i is looking to strengthen its team of data scientists by introducing a role of Chief Data Scientist who is expected to architect, build and maintain innovative products for the water and weather environments.

Chief Data Scientist is a leadership and hands-on position with responsibilities for overseeing activities of the junior data science team ensuring proper execution of duties and alignment with the business’s overall vision. Chief Data Scientist is responsible for the creation of new data sciences capabilities within the company by envisioning and executing strategies that influence improvement of the business’s performance.

Chief Data Scientist is expected to proactively work with other business executives and unit heads across the company in order to provide advanced analytic data modelling systems. Chief Data Scientist will be responsible for design and launch of innovative and complex analytic models, utilizing a blend of contemporary and traditional machine learning techniques, which will be applied to both structured and unstructured data sets.

Chief Data Scientist leads the development of big data capabilities and utilization as well as the coordination of cross-functional analytic initiatives.

Education: Chief Data Scientist has to have MSc or PhD degree in Statistics, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or any other related quantitative field. A working experience of the same is also acceptable for the position.

Experience: A candidate for this position has to have had at least 7 years of working experience in a data science position, preferably working as a Senior Data Scientist. The candidate for this position will have to be highly proficient and experienced in scripting languages and have rapid prototyping skills, that is, fluency in SQL, Python, Perl, Java, VB and deep learning toolboxes like Tensorflow and PyTorch. In addition to this, chief Data Scientist is expected to poses project management skills and/or capacity to lead a team of data engineers and data scientists to complete projects within time and budget.
The candidate must also have a proven and successful experience track record of leading high-performing data analyst teams leading through the successful performance of advanced quantitative analyses and statistical modelling that positively impact business performance.

Communication Skills: Communication skills will be a necessity for Chief Data Scientist. As a leader she/he must be able to convey important messages and information down the line in order to ensure proper exception of duties by junior data science personnel. Communication skills will also be a necessity for the Head of Data Science and in his collaborative capacity where information must be clearly articulated between the collaborating parties in order to ensure effective,

Interpersonal Skills: A suitable candidate for this position will be a team-builder, be result-oriented, be proactive and self-driven requiring minimal supervision, be open and welcoming to change, be a creative and strategic thinker, have innovative problem-solving skills, be highly organized, have an ability to handle multiple simultaneous tasks prioritize and meet tight deadlines, and demonstrate calmness in times of uncertainty and stress.

People Skills: Chief Data Scientist is a people person who is able to form strong, lasting, and meaningful bonds with others people. This will make him an approachable and trustworthy individual who junior personnel readily follow and who senior Data and Analytics executives and stakeholders trust and who’s insights they give credit to, making execution of his duties that much easier.

About Us

The Hydroinformatics Institute develops and applies technology-enabled, digital solutions to some of the world’s most pressing water-related challenges. Our products and services help clients harness the power of data, advanced analytics, and modelling to unlock insights at the global, regional, and local levels – and in real time. The team’s expertise spans hydrodynamic modelling, water quality modelling of inland and coastal water systems, weather management, and operational management systems.
H2i is SaaS-based, Water-as-a-Service provider behind landmark water management projects in countries including Brunei, Oman, Singapore, Sri Lanka, Philippines, and Vietnam. In 2018, we were named Small Business Rising Star at the Winsemius Awards.

Implementation in Machine learning projects is a plus.

Roles & Responsibilities
Overview of the role
As a Data Analyst, you will be identifying opportunities for data exploitation through in-depth conversations with business stakeholders. You will scope out data analytics projects with clear deliverables that are actionable and impactful, and execute them in close iteration with the stakeholders.

You are a great communicator who can engage stakeholders in sharpening their business problems, obtaining feedback, and sharing findings to influence actionable outcomes. You are dextrous in data manipulation, data modelling, and data visualization, and can identify the most appropriate tools and techniques for each business use case. You are a problem solver with strong analytical skills and can be relied upon to deliver sound data science solutions.

Roles & Responsibilities
You will be responsible for:
Working together with internal teams (e.g.: product, marketing) to understand user behaviour through exploratory data analysis and insights
Leading deep-dive analysis to support data-driven decisions and uncover areas of growth or improvement
Designing, developing, maintaining and improving new and existing reports and dashboards
Participating in the development of machine learning models
Skills
Must have:
At least a Bachelor’s degree in an analytical field (e.g.: Statistics, Computer Science)
Excellent analytical thinking
Proficiency in SQL
Experience building reports/dashboards in any of the major BI tools (e.g.: Tableau, Power BI, Qlik)
For the Data Analyst role at least 2 years, for the Senior Data Analyst role at least 5 years of experience in Analytics / Business Intelligence
Ability to translate business problems into technical solutions
Good command of python and its libraries (e.g.: pandas, scikit-learn)
Good presentation skills to both teammates and a non-technical audience
Attention to detail
Nice to have:
Experience with AWS (e.g.: Redshift, Lambda)
Experience in developing machine learning solutions for production use
Domain knowledge in Healthcare or Public Health
ABOUT HEALINT
Healint is a leading maker of healthcare technology used all over the world. Healint leverages innovative techniques in software, data science, and user experience design to empower people to manage their chronic conditions and diseases. Healint’s first global program - the Migraine Buddy platform and its apps - helps a thriving community of users manages and track their migraines. To date, Migraine Buddy has recorded terabytes of data that helps patients, doctors, and researchers better understand the real-world causes and effects of neurological disorders. We're committed to revolutionizing healthcare technology and are continually looking to add talented people to the Healint team. We promise challenging problems, an opportunity to have a real impact on people's lives, and an environment where you'll learn rapidly from one of the best teams in Singapore.

Roles & Responsibilities
About the role
As a Data Analyst at DATAVLT, you will be reporting to the Head of Data Scientist and Software Engineers who are focused on solving complex business problems,using data science as an underlying technology.

Responsibilities
As our Data Analyst, you will•
· Process confidential data and information according to guidelines
· Help on build innovative data products using cutting edge tools and technologies
· Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.
· Undertake pre-processing of structured and unstructured data
· Analyse large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
· Propose solutions and strategies to business challenges
· Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise:
· Proficiency using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
· Have foundational knowledge of data structures and algorithms
· Excellent analytical, interpersonal and communication skills.
· Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on product development.
· Experience working with and creating data architectures.
· Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
· Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
· Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
· Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Dockers, MySQL, etc.
· Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders using: Tableau, High charts, D3, gg plot, etc.

Good to have
· Minimum 3 years working experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models, has a Master’s in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or another quantitative field, and is familiar with the software/tools
· Experience with customizing Data Visualization tools
· Have fundamental knowledge of blockchain technology
· Software development experience added advantage
· A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques. What's in it for you
· Help shape the future of a Data Analytics and Blockchain start-up in Singapore with global aspirations
· Be yourself, be engaged and have fun while you're at it
· Fair remuneration
· Open work culture

Interested Candidate please email to : hr@datavlt.com

Do you like helping enterprise clients implement innovative cloud solutions and solve technical problems?
Do you want to be the leader and demonstrate how the emerging technologies (such as A.I., Big Data, Cloud, DevOps) can be applied to businesses?
With business growth and global expansion opportunities, we are looking for a highly motivated Pre-Sales to help accelerate our growing technical team.
This is an excellent opportunity to join a world class technical team, working with some of the best and brightest engineers and account managers while also developing your skills and furthering your career within one of the most innovative and progressive technology young companies in ASEAN.
Job Duties
Build end-to-end data architecture on cloud including data extraction, data transformation and data modeling
Perform high performance data discovery, big data analytics, defining transformation logic and data model
Data mining and statistical techniques to develop insights and transformational outcomes, visualise data and insights
Translating data mining results into a clear business-focused deliverables
Requirements
Overseas work and travelling is expected
Passionate in Data and Analytics; Preferably interested in Cloud Technology
At least 3 years of AWS data related working experience, e.g. Redshift, Glue, EMR
Strongdata analytics experience with proficiency in SQL / Python / R
Hands-on experience with any of the BI Tools (Tableau / Qlik / Alteryx / PowerBI)
Strong communication and presentation skills

Roles & Responsibilities
Keyrus is an international consulting firm, specializing in the integration of data intelligence and Digital solutions. With over 3000 employees spread across 20 countries, Keyrus continues to deliver on such projects to a wide range of clients from various industries including but not limited to Banking/Finance, Healthcare/pharmaceuticals, FMCG, Oil & Gas, and more.

As part of Keyrus’ solution delivery, we are also in a position to recruit and place technical consultants to complement on existing client projects with their expertise. As such, we seek innovative and agile people to support ambitious and forthcoming technological challenges.
The team in Singapore is currently looking for several Data Analytics Consultants, in order to support our client activities.

Main responsibilities

 Develop automated reports and dashboards using Power BI
 Connect to multiple datasets to bring all the relevant data together in one place and create reports that provide a consolidated view of the different sources
 Creating Power BI reports that represent different findings & insights from the data using interactive charts and maps.
 Work with both functional and technical project personnel, providing in-depth knowledge of BI information delivery/presentation methodology
 Document processes and ensure they are properly followed
 Elaborating project documentations (Design documents, deployment guide etc.)
 Maintenance of existing BI projects Interacting and providing reporting to project managers / managers
 Ensure high standard delivery to production
 Proposing solutions for regarding continuous improvement
 Provide investigation help while fostering knowledge and sharing best practices with team members

Qualifications and Profile

Mandatory

 At least 5 years in software development with thorough knowledge of scripting, data source integration and advanced GUI development in Power BI
 Familiar with any tracking tool like Jira
 Strong BI modelling skills using Analysis services with the ability translate reporting needs to a BI model which can serve the report as well as adhoc analytics
 4+ years of experience in BI tools (tableau, qlikview etc.) with 2+ years’ experience in Power BI with in-depth development experience with recent versions of SQL Server.
 Experience creating calculated measures and columns with DAX in MS Power BI Desktop
 Expert knowledge using advanced calculations using MS Power BI Desktop (Aggregate, Date, Logical, String, Table)
 Strong knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server (2014- 2017), MSSQL, SSRS (2014 and 2017), and SSIS (2014 and 2017)
 You have experience in writing SQL queries and optimisation and knowledge in database engine and data model

Roles & Responsibilities
Clarksons Platou Asia Pte Limited is recruiting for two permanent positions in its growing team within the research business of the Clarksons Group. The Clarksons Group is the world’s leading provider of integrated shipping services and a FTSE 250 company. Further information about the group can be found here: http://www.clarksons.com. The research business, Clarkson Research, is a leading provider of market intelligence and research to the global maritime transport and offshore & energy industries, with presences in London, Shanghai and Singapore.

Job Description

We are currently offering an opportunity to join our growing research team based in Singapore. The successful candidates will be joining a fast-expanding business offering great opportunities for career progression. His/Her primary responsibilities in the marine market and infrastructure sectors will consist of:

Conduct data collection and maintain data sources relating to the relevant sectors, particularly for the Marine Infrastructure industry; facilitate its transfer to formal databases and subsequent output from those databases.
Manage projects and liaise with internal and external stakeholders to improve the content and quality of formal databases.
Contribute to regular analysis and reports on the key markets, products, and bespoke client projects.
Handle and assist in the management of enquiries on the data and related output in an accurate and timely manner to meet colleagues’ and clients’ requirements.
Investigate new methods and techniques to improve market coverage and manage the implementation of said methods in conjunction with the relevant manager.
Develop and maintain a network of industry contacts for collecting market intelligence.
Observe the requirements of the quality control system and relevant operating procedures, including keeping operating instructions, sources and methodology, and other relevant documentation up to date.
Maintain responsibility for personal development including training, with a view to developing the capability to take increased responsibility.
Candidate Requirements

A recent graduate with a degree in a numerate or analytical subject, or an individual with 1-2 years’ experience in a similar role through internships or previous full-time employment.
Experience in data management, optimisation models or economic/mathematical modelling.
An advanced knowledge of standard software applications, including those used for data storage, analysis and publishing. This includes Microsoft Office, MS Access, SQL and Excel. Experience with geographical information systems is beneficial.
Commercial awareness of the maritime & offshore industries is preferred.
Exceptional literacy and analytical skill, with the ability to analyse and present information in a clear and coherent way.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal (English). A second business language is advantageous.
Excellent organisational skills, high level of attention to detail and the ability to manage own workload.
How to Apply

If you feel that you would be able to succeed in this role, please send your resume and covering letter to Mr Johannes Judy at johannes.judy@clarksons.com. Please quote Reference Number CRSL/RES/FMI2105 on all correspondence. Please apply by 11/06/2021.

Duties & Responsibilities

The incumbent is responsible for working within the information technology group, participating in a team responsible for report generation and data analysis utilizing database management software/tools against various database platforms. In this role the incumbent will assist in the development of automated reports, analytical and management reports, and data definitions across multiple computing environments.

The incumbent will develop technical expertise in data mining and report development methodologies, techniques, and tools to ensure deliverables meet the needs of both internal and external business customers.

Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems or related discipline with at least 1-3 years of experience or equivalent knowledge in mastering database management software/tools, including proficiency in SQL query building and report writing.
Familiarity with MSSQL (2012 and above), advanced MSSQL features (linked servers, dbmail, bcp) to use in automating data delivery, file creation, notifications, Business objects/Crystal Reports Enterprise Server, scheduling reports, Open Database Connectivity (ODBC) creation/usage, Microsoft Access table creation, queries, macros, forms and reports, Visual Basic for Applications (VBA)
Proficient with MSSQL stored procedure creation, job creation, general report automation, MSSQL server tools (SSIS/Integration SVCS, SSRS/Reporting SVCS), Creating & Modifying using Crystal Reports Software.

Possess a strong organizational skills with demonstrated attention to detail
Proactive, able to work under tight deadline efficiently and with high quality
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Experience in Retail industry experience is preferred.

Support in providing recommendations through detailed analysis on marketing campaigns happening regionally across various product groups in the business.
Create actionable insights through data extraction, manipulation and implementation. Focus mainly on creating analyses around spending, investments and effectiveness of the product and marketing teams.
Share the insights with various business partners, stakeholders and teams across the company
Create detailed dashboards, forecasting models, statistical insights to manage productivity of the ongoing campaigns.

Roles & Responsibilities
Who we are
Johnson Controls is the global leader for smart, healthy and sustainable buildings. At Johnson Controls, we’ve been making buildings smarter since 1885, and our capabilities, depth of innovation experience, and global reach have been growing ever since. Today, we offer the world’s largest portfolio of building products, technologies, software, and services; we put that portfolio to work to transform the environments where people live, work, learn and play.

This is where Johnson Controls comes in, helping drive the outcomes that matter most. Through a full range of systems and digital solutions, we make your buildings smarter. A smarter building is safer, more comfortable, more efficient, and, ultimately, more sustainable. Most important, smarter buildings let you focus more intensely on your unique mission. Better for your people. Better for your bottom line. Better for the planet. We’re helping to create a healthy planet with solutions that decrease energy use, reduce waste and make carbon neutrality a reality.

Sustainability is a top priority for our company. We committed to invest 75 percent of new product development R&D in climate-related innovation to develop sustainable products and services. We take sustainability seriously. Achieving net zero carbon emissions before 2040 is just one of our commitments to making the world a better place.

What you will do
The Data Analyst will support the identification of sales opportunities through the systematic mining of existing databases, including but not limited to, SMX, SFDC, and other market, customer and transaction databases maintained by Johnson Controls
Support Inside Sales team by providing consolidated leads mined from installed base
Maintain and aggregate various data sources to create consolidated view of sales opportunities, from installed base through to entitlement, pipeline, and current service contracts
Track, analyze and communicate the performance of country sales activities; support country sales lead to prepare sales forecasts and reports for updates to local and regional leadership
Provide analytical support to sales and other selling related activities
How you will do it
Use analytics to support sales function, e.g., through providing transparency on market or customer information, or applying analytics-driven problem-solving to sales challenges, e.g., setting criteria to establish propensity to buy to improve lead quality
Systematically identify sales opportunities to push through to Inside Sales team for lead generation/qualification through rules-based mining of existing databases
Proactively suggest tools/platforms that can improve/automate the process of data gathering, consolidation, analysis, and sharing
Ensure data tools and platforms used by Johnson Controls are up to date
Build and maintain single “source of truth” for country level data, consolidating multiple data sources across installed base, entitlement, SMX, SFDC, customer, transaction, and other databases used and maintained by Johnson Controls
Build and maintain visual dashboards (e.g., on PowerBI or Tableau) to support sales function to track and monitor pipeline and achievement to targets effectively
What we are looking for
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Programming, Data Science, Math, or related field
Advanced knowledge of Excel
Proficiency in advanced analytics and programming tools, e.g., Alteryx, R and Python
Proficiency in visual dashboarding tools, e.g., PowerBI or Tableau
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Detail orientation with ability to see big-picture trends
Demonstrated ability to multi-task and meet established deadlines
Ability to work efficiently as part of a team; ability to manage own tasks with little/no supervision

Diversity & Inclusion
Our dedication to diversity and inclusion starts with our values. We lead with integrity and purpose, focusing on the future and aligning with our customers’ vision for success. Our High-Performance Culture ensures that we have the best talent that is highly engaged and eager to innovate.  Our D&I mission elevates each employee’s responsibility to contribute to our culture. It’s through these contributions that we’ll drive the mindsets and behaviors we need to power our customers’ missions. You have the power. You have the voice. You have the culture in your hands.

Roles & Responsibilities
Who are we?
Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 210 data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed.
At Equinix, we help the world’s digital leaders scale with agility, speed the launch of digital services, deliver world-class experiences, and transform people’s lives. Our culture is based on collaboration and the growth and development of our teams.
We hire hardworking people who thrive on solving challenging problems and give them opportunities to hone new skills, and try new approaches, as we grow our product portfolio with new software and network architecture solutions. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment. that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.
Job Summary: Partners with the business and IT community to ensure that the right people have access to the right data in the right format at the right time. This Data Scientist is an advanced technical professional responsible for exploring and analyzing data across the enterprise and presenting information and key insights that support the organization's strategies. The Data Scientist has in-depth knowledge across multiple technical environments as well as strong business acumen and provides expertise regarding systems design, integration and performance analysis across the business. The role expects the knowledge of data wrangling and data analysis for better storytelling with data. The role promotes shared infrastructure and applications to reduce costs and improve information flows, and it ensures that new technology solutions do not duplicate functionality or diverge from each other and business and IT strategies. Takes direction from leads and continues to develop hands-on knowledge.
Responsibilities
Business Analysis
Takes direction from lead analysts on identified opportunities and improves organizational effectiveness with enhanced or new analysis techniques and insights
Participates and learns on gathering core requirements within broader context
Visualization
Ability to provide storytelling with data. Engage in knit various data from different data sources and build compelling story to enable better insights into data
Analyze and investigate various data using visualization techniques using tools like Tableau, Power BI
Experiment with data using advances analytics techniques to identify unique insights in data and share them to stakeholders
Develops compelling data visualizations, dashboards, tools and utilities using Open Source technologies (D3, React.js, etc.) and tools like Tableau, Power BI, etc.
Organizes data in visually innovative ways in order to make it easy to understand to the stakeholders and technical folks at the same time
Data Modeling & Analysis & Wrangling
Understands relationships between data elements in different sources and builds models to help analyze
Works with large volumes of data; extracts and manipulates large datasets using standard tools such as Python, Hadoop, R, SQL, Spark, etc.
Analyzes and cleans data needed for various data science projects
Communicates data patterns identified in both internal and external data using various wrangling techniques
Helps in data discovery and evolving use cases to identify prediction/prescriptive solutions
Stakeholder Management
Understands stakeholder expectations and communications within the area of delivery
Takes direction to identify and include correct stakeholders
Interacts regularly with the team in reviewing current solutions, results and evolving models in ensuring results are fine-tuned constantly
Solution Design
Participates in brainstorming sessions to understand various internal/external factors that can impact the data analysis
Participates in solutions to assigned requirements
Participates with the team to analyze and propose innovative solutions to replace legacy systems and data, such as individually-created and widely dispersed databases and spreadsheets, to better align with Equinix enterprise information standards and strategies
Applies knowledge in design, development, implementation and management of data sources
Learns and applies modeling techniques and implementation methodologies
Utilizes basic statistical models, algorithms and machine learning models in designing the solution
Develops technical skills in exploring and analyzing data across the enterprise and presents information and key insights that support the organization's growth and sustain strategies
Documentation
Documents project deliverables in collaboration with teams and business users
Data Management/Architecture/Design
Develops knowledge across a few technical environments
Understands and develops data sources and data architectures to address business requirements
Follows Industry trends and vendor capabilities to produce robust functional designs
Understands innovation in the space of Cloud Big Data by exploring and implementing data centric technologies, on Data Platforms like GCP, AWS
Under direction, builds solutions to bring data from various source systems both internal and external to Equinix
Testing & Test Design
Understands the business problem and technical design and develops test cases in alignment
Collaborates with senior BSAs and technical team to develop test cases
Project Management
Manages end-to-end delivery of enhancements
Plans the delivery cycle in line with release goals
Software Engineering
Develops skills in data warehousing methodologies and tools
Learns and works with scripting/programming languages (Perl, Python, PHP, Java, VB, C#, R, etc.) in developing solutions
Vendor Management
Assists vendor resources with onboarding activities through all Equinix channels: email, laptop, access to systems, workspace, etc.
Vendor & Technology Evaluation
Conducts analysis on vendor and application options, i.e., Magic Quadrant, as a key input to selection cycles
Assists in building RFP documentation and selection criteria tools
Qualifications
5+ years experience
Bachelor's in Data Science, Computer Science or Machine Learning
Equinix is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

Roles & Responsibilities
As a Data Engineer, your responsibilities will include but are not limited to the following:
Design, build, integrate and manage data from various sources for analytics purposes; 
Develop, implement and perform ETL processes to integrate data from different data sources and create datasets for data modelling, mining and production use by data analyst and analytics end-users in an optimum and secured manner; 
Design, develop and implement data, data sources, and report management processes as per organisational policies and requirements at both database (SQL Servers) and reporting layers (Tableau Server); 
Work with stakeholders – data owners, data analytics teams and analytics end-users to resolve data-related technical issues and achieve project goals; and 
Work with IT and data analytics team to identify, design and implement architecture, infrastructure and process improvements to enhance performance of NP’s data analytics ecosystem.
* This is a fixed-term contract appointment till 30 Dec 2023.

Pre-requisites:
At least 3 years of relevant work experience
Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring using SQL
Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets
Strong project management and organisational skills
Experience working with the following:
Relational SQL (including MSSQL, Oracle, and MySQL) and NoSQL databases (including Postgres and MongoDB)
Python and/or R for data applications
Tableau Desktop and/or MicroStrategy, Alteryx Designer and/or Informatica software tools
Manipulate, process and extract value from large disconnected datasets
Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management
Build and optimise data pipelines, architectures and data sets
Support and work with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment

Check out the details of the position and submit online at Careers@Gov. Be part of an institution with that something xtra.

Roles & Responsibilities
Responsibilities
· Feature engineering on financial market data and market trends
· Research on financial market data with purpose of detecting trading behaviour anomaly and market patterns
· Develop risk management system for the exchange by identifying the leading factors of market movements and measuring the impact of market fluctuations
· Enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems
· Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis
· Building models to address business problem
· Presenting information using data visualization techniques
· Selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques
· Extending company’s data with third party sources of information when needed
· Creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance

Requirements
· Proven previous experience as a Data Scientist or Data Analyst
· Large market experience (USA, China, India etc) required
· Degree in Computer Science / Statistics / Mathematics / Financial Engineering or other quantitative field is a must
· Ability to speak native level Mandarin in order to collaborate with Mandarin speaking colleagues and clients based in Mainland China, who can’t speak English
· Experience in data mining
· Experience in machine learning application in finance market data, preferably in pattern recognition, anomaly detection. Familiarity with unsupervised algorithms
· Proficiency in Python/C++/Java/R
· Working experience with databases like SQL/ElasticSearch
· Exposure to algorithm trading and knowledge of market microstructure is a plus
· Familiarity with AWS and Linux is a plus
· Good applied statistics skills, such as distributions, statistical testing, regression, etc
· Problem Solving aptitude
· Ability to meet deadlines and work in a fast-paced environment
· Team player who is independent and collaborative

Roles & Responsibilities
Temporarily Work From Home
Work Life Balance
Great Working Environment

IQPC provides business executives around the world with tailored practical conferences, large-scale events, topical seminars, in-house training programs, and delivers a full suite of B2B digital opportunities, keeping them up-to-date with industry trends. IQPC produces more than 1,500 events annually around the world, and continues to grow. Founded in 1973, IQPC now has offices in major cities across six continents including Berlin, Dubai, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and Tampa. IQPC's large-scale conferences are market leading “must attend” events for their respective industries.

SSON Analytics is the global data analytics centre of the Shared Services & Outsourcing Network (SSON), a division of IQPC. At SSON Analytics, we offer visual data insights that are simple, accurate, and digestible through a variety of data tools and analytics reports to the SSON community (i.e. global business services executives and business leaders who leverage technology and best practices to improve operational efficiency).
The Role
SSON Analytics is seeking an experienced Full-Stack Web Developer to join the team. As a Web Developer, you will be responsible for creating the visual analytics reports and managing the various data tools on the SSON Analytics website and its internal applications.

· Coding both server-side and the frontend for existing web-based applications - for both internal and client-facing applications. Developing and maintaining new & existing APIs.
· Work closely with Data Analyst and/or Data Scientist to publish visual analytics workbook (VAW), design/implement interactive data visualisation tools and possibly to build any product/tools required by the business.
· Must be able to debug/investigate and/or fix if issues found in the current applications.
· Able to own projects from end to end - from wireframing, designing DB structures, coding the front-end & the back-end/API, testing, up to deployment & maintenance.
· Should have a strong understanding and/or have practical experience with API Development, database design (MySQL) and AWS.
· Experience with data visualisations is a great plus.
· Be interested in continuous improvement and ongoing ways to enhance the user experience

Requirements

· A minimum of 2 year experience of working in web development
· The ideal candidate should be passionate, have excellent communication skills, the willingness to learn and the ability to work to strict deadlines.
· Experience working in frontend with HTML5, CSS, Javascript, Bootstrap, jQuery, Angular 1.x, vueJS.
· Experience working in the backend with apache/nginx, PHP particularly with Laravel/Lumen is a must.
· Experience with databases especially MySQL and must have a good understanding of SQL queries at least.
· Familiar with the following visualisation/charting libraries: Highcharts/Highmaps, D3 & google API for maps.
· Experience with 3rd party APIs such as google API, AWS/S3 API is a plus
· Experience with managing AWS particularly EC2 and S3 is a plus.
· Experience in source control (git/bitbucket)
· Experience with continuous build and deployment using Jenkins is a plus.
· Knowledgeable in Web Analytics & SEO is also a plus.

Roles & Responsibilities
Industrial Internet-of-Things Innovation (I3)
The Industrial Internet-of-Things Innovation (I3) is a new industry-led initiative by the Science and Engineering Research Council (SERC) of Agency for Science, Technology and Research (A*STAR). Based on a contemporary business model of public-private partnership, the initiative accelerates and drives the adoption of Industrial Internet-of-Things (IIoT) research into industry ready solutions for cross-sectoral industry partners by bringing together best-in-class global companies and R&D minds in Singapore.
Currently, I3 is ramping up its programme with potential partners to develop IIoT capabilities. The partners are comprised of global MNCs, Large Local Enterprises, leading sensors, communications and system providers as well as SMEs.
At I3, you will have a unique opportunity to unleash your creativity and competencies to develop innovative solutions for industry partners. Spanning across our key technical areas in track, monitor and optimize, you will help industry partners to realize the full potential of IIoT possibilities, from product development, integrated systems and solutions, and aftermarket customer care and services. You will also be part of an exciting IIoT network, developing world-class knowledge in the field of IIoT.
Key Responsibilities
The IIoT Data Analytic Research Engineer as part of I3 core team, will work closely with technology providers, A*STAR RIs, and IHLs to develop capabilities and new technologies for industry IoT ecosystems. The candidate will be responsible for:
Preprocess of structured and unstructured data
Analyze large amounts of data to discover trends and patterns
Build predictive models and machine learning algorithms
Present information using data visualization tools and techniques
Develop and deploy machine learning algorithms at the edge
Develop digital signal processing algorithm for sensors and sensor fusion
BS/Eng, MS/Eng in Computer Science/Engineering, or related fields
Work experience as a data analyst or in related field
Good experience in machine learning and deep learning
Knowledge of digital signal processing of sensor data
Proficient in Python, R, SQL, and C/C++
Candidate will be required to have strong critical thinking, problem solving, and excellent communication skills
Entry level candidates with a track record of the above mentioned are encouraged to apply
The above eligibility criteria are not exhaustive. A*STAR may include additional selection criteria based on its prevailing recruitment policies. These policies may be amended from time to time without notice. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Are you an individual who has a sharp eye for details to spot relevant data trends and patterns? Are you comfortable with large volumes of data and yet have the ability to tell a story through it? If you are all the above, this career opportunity may just be for you!

We are looking for a Data Reporting Analyst to join the Group Business Analytics team to support the business operations.

This role includes:

• Reporting to the manager of Group Business Analytics, this role is to provide financial analysis/insight through data within Group Business, support the financial planning and reporting function within the business units.
• 3 Key Accountabilities are Strategic, Operational and Effective Risk Management/Governance.
• Identify key performance drivers within the business based on:
a) Creation and maintenance of MI dashboards
b) Assist in providing insight for the MI reports
c) Ensure accuracy and timeliness of various scheduled reports and databases
d) Maintenance of database used for business reporting
• Develop and monitor scheduled MI reports and dashboards according to the business units requirements.
• Support strategic marketing initiatives/projects from providing requirements and business analytics data support to completion and successful delivery and launch of the initiatives/projects.

Education Qualifications

• Tertiary education in Business Analytics/ Statistics / Mathematics/ Accounting/ Computer Science

Required Capabilities

• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
• Highly developed time management and prioritization skills
• Good communication and inter-personal skills
• A general understanding on the operations of insurance business

Roles & Responsibilities
The Data Analytics team works collaboratively to deliver strategic projects that are groundbreaking for customers and transforming the way we work to achieve our vision of innovating to help everyone live well.
On a day to day basis, we help to translate strategy into specific strategic initiatives and take these initiatives from concept to execution. These strategic initiatives are primarily cross-functional, and Data Analytics team delivers these initiatives by bringing together the deep operational capabilities from within the organization.
Role:
The Data Analyst will work closely with Data Modeler, Data Engineers, Business/Data Analyst, Business Stakeholders to implement solutions to streamline and support enterprise data management strategies.
Responsibilities:
Understand and translate the business needs into data models supporting long-term solution. Work side by side with internal teams to understand the business requirements
Work with Development team to implement data strategies, build data flows, and data models.
Collate, review, and analyze data collected from various sources across the department and portfolio like source system application, CRM, legacy system, and etc.
Support the development and establishment of the data function across the business.
Essential technical skills in analyzing and mapping data from source to target.
Document and provide data investigation insights to business / project teams.
Perform reverse engineering of physical data models from databases and SQL scripts.
Analyze data-related system integration challenges and propose appropriate solutions.
Guide system analyst, data engineers, programmers, and others on project limitations and capabilities, performance requirements and interfaces.
Identify the architecture, infrastructure, and interfaces to data sources, tool supporting automated data loads, security concerns, analytics models, and data visualization.
Provide critical data support for increase level of reporting as the program moves into delivery phase.
Skills and Experience:
Experience in multiple relevant topics such as data warehouse, master data management, information design, data analytics, and knowledge management.
Good hands-on experience in creating and designing data model such as logical and physical data models using 2 or more of the following approach: Dimensional Data Model, Normalize Data Model, Data Vault, Semantic Data Modeling, and etc.
Minimum 2 years of experience in business process mapping, data flow, and data lineage.
At least 2 years of experience in design and development in terms of ETL specifications for data integration development.
Knowledge and experience in metadata management and related tools.
Strong SQL Skills and good experience in with databases, DB Queries, and able to manipulate data & understand the impacts.
Outstanding problem-solving skills.
3 – 5 years of experience in technical operations working with On-Premise and Cloud technologies (RDBMS, Big Data, Azure, AWS)
Good to have:
Experience in the development at least 2 of the following: (i) Python, PySpark, and/or SAS and, (ii) Big Data and Cloud Platform connecting to different types data such as structured and semi-structured.
Experience working in Financial Industry like Insurance and Banks.
Experience in the design and development using Data Factory and Databricks
Experience the design and development using BI Tool (e.g. Qlik Sense, Power BI, and etc.).

Roles & Responsibilities
Toku’s mission is to help companies engage with their customers efficiently. We have helped companies move all the voice communications to the cloud and recently embarked on creating products that help companies keep engaging with their customers no matter where their employees are working from.
Toku is currently getting into a scale-up mode. We want to continue creating momentum for our products in the APAC regions and helping customers with their communications needs. As we build the Business Intelligence foundation, we are looking for an experienced Data Analyst who can help provide insights for the company. Want to be part of our journey?

What would you be doing?

You will report to our Database Administrator. You are responsible to develop, implement and manage data, business processes, reports, applications, and dashboards that optimize Business functions to meet organisational goals. You will use visualisation tools and software to communicate information to present large amounts of information in ways that are universally understandable and easy to interpret. We are looking for passionate individuals who can build systems and use data to help us measure every area of the business and influence decision-making.

· Develop, test and provision, routine and interactive analytic dashboards/reports, data visualisation applications and self-service data applications.
· Facilitate discussions and partner with business end-users as well as colleagues in the organisation to develop and implement collaborative solutions to data and analytics problems.
· Explore the possible areas of automation, develop and deploy suitable applications using scripting languages.
· Understand and build support data models to identify data requirements for visualisation.
· Resolve most appropriate visualization types to build a compelling story.
· Uphold data standards (hierarchy, formats, naming conventions, levels of aggregation, timing of availability etc)
· Perform quality control to ensure the visualization is easy to use, meets performance criteria, presents accurate data etc.
· Develop a corporate style guide for data visualizations, dashboards, and reporting.

We would love to hear from you if you have:

· At least Bachelor’s degree in Data Science / Information Technology / Statistics, Mathematics or relevant field
· Minimum 4 years of relevant working experience
· Strong Power BI skills: Knowledge using advanced calculations using MS Power BI (Aggregate, Date, Logical, String, Table)
· Analytical mind and business acumen with ability to work with large amounts of data to discover patterns and trends and to form conclusions based on findings.
· Good SQL knowledge with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
· Working knowledge on scripting languages: Python, R or Scala
· Strong verbal and written communication skills
· Strong problem-solving skills (e.g., analytical, quantitative, and conceptual thinking)
· Team player with an ability to function effectively in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.

If you would love to experience working in a start-up growing at an accelerated speed, and you think you tick most of the requirements, come join us!
