job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
AIA Group Investment is implementing a Data Governance programme as part of our Data Transformation journey.
The new Data Governance framework will enable improved Investment Data Quality by reinforcing Data Ownership across the Business and rolling-out systematic Investment Data Quality Controls as per the DQM Framework (ie. CDE, Data Quality rules & threshold definition, Data Quality issue management including remediation and escalation process).
The Investment Data Governance function and framework is targeted to be in placed in Q4 2021.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
As part of the DMO team, your role will be as follows:
Ensure increased control of our data and it’s data lineage by focusing on data operations & control on what is required by investment processes
Ensure data sets are complete, and represent exhaustively our Target Operating Model (eg. General Assets vs ILP, different asset class and it’s investment lifecycle)
Ensure Data Quality - besides data completeness, it is imperative to ensure data is also accurate (single source of truth) and timely so it can be used with confidence by business users in their investment processes (This will include identifying key elements underpinning data quality, understanding how data is used and why it is important and bridging the gap in the investment processes)
The candidate is also expected to understand how AIA data is used (data flow) and how it will impact investment processes and be able to recommend different metrics and controls and part of continuous improvement (eg. more standardisation of data, improved validation of data)
Like many organizations, in AIA data quality checking is often carried out in silos and resource intensive (different teams) across the various processing areas within the organisation.
In many cases it is done manually and sometimes duplicated across different areas. Hence, as part of the Data Governance programme AIA is implementing a Data Governance tool to systemize and automate the data quality check, ensuring that only appropriate exceptions are raised and allocated to relevant staff for action. This tool will also enable more efficient and effect data error reporting, which in turns enables us to immediately review any data process gaps and fix them timely.
As part of the DMO team, you will be also expected to support the Data Governance tool roll-out.
Experience in implementing Data Governance tool (at least 1 successful implementation cycle) in Infogix, Informatica, Curium, Collibra, Ataccama or similar tools will be an added advantage.

REQUIREMENTS:
Education – Minimum undergraduate
Minimum 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst cum Data Analyst with leading role in establishing Data Governance initiatives for a reputable investment management company.
Knowledge in Investment processes and data (security, pricing, reference data, corporate action and transaction data) for an asset management company is an advantage
Experience or knowledge in Data Modelling and Database table schemas
Must be an expert in Microsoft excel, Visio and business presentations
Excellent communication and writing skills
Strong SQL/PL-SQL knowledge to query database would be an added advantage

For interested applicants, kindly send your updated resume to Marie Goh at MarieG@charterhouse.com.sg.

Job Description
Compliance Conduct & Operational Risk (CCOR) Data Management is responsible for performing the Chief Data Office (CDO) responsibilities, including the implementation and oversight and governance of the Firmwide Data Management Standards and Policies. As part of this role there is a requirement to partner with Corporate Technology teams to identify data quality issues on a daily basis, and ensure they are reported and tracked in accordance with the Firmwide Data Office Policy. This role will also require partnering with other Lines of Business to help influence Firmwide policy and/or best practice. CCOR DM is responsible for various projects/initiatives that focus on the implementation of the Firmwide Data Standards and Policies requirements, improving data quality, operational efficiencies and controls for the CCOR organization, including the Firmwide Data Content Owner initiative
Key Responsibilities:
Monitor delivery and completeness of feed/files into and throughout the Compliance environment and escalate delays to the appropriate stakeholders

Our Business Promise – Connecting Businesses Globally

We work closely together, in the spirit of the family-business at our origins. At the same time, backed by a reputable and financially strong private equity firm, KKR, Goodpack provides great exposure and myriad opportunities to impact at a local, organizational and global level.

About the Opportunity
As a Senior Data Analyst you will be have a key role in building our newly established regional data and analytics pillar. Data Modelling

Roles & Responsibilities
Data Analyst

ABOUT SPARKLINE:

At Sparkline, we’re not interested in being ‘the smartest guy in the room’! We want to be a trusted partner, strategic asset and integral part of our client’s business. We are a small team and at our strongest when we leverage each other’s strengths. We roll up our sleeves and move at lightning pace to get the job done!

OUR DNA:
Passion for digital and data, and the value it brings to both consumers and businesses
Dedication to become a value based partner, delivering above and beyond client expectations
Humility to work with integrity, good intent and transparency
Curiosity to explore the possibilities and the opportunities from the information you are given
Creativity to see beyond the answer and use insights to effectively reach potential customers
Fail Fast, Learn Faster it’s about progress not perfection
Entrepreneurial in attitude and action, effortlessly innovating and adapting
Embrace Change - ‘It’s not the strongest or the most intelligent who will survive, but those that can best manage change’....that’s Charles Darwin by the way!
THE ROLE

At Sparkline, we are in the people business! Our Data Analysts are passionate about helping our Client’s use data to develop a multi-view of their customer and deliver improvements across the customer journey to achieve competitive advantage and amazing customer experiences.
Our Analysts build a working knowledge of the Client’s business, leverage industry knowledge and analytics techniques to provide creative solutions to solve real business problems. As a passionate storyteller you can present your insights in the form of a narrative. You are comfortable across all communication channels and can tailor your message to help cross functional stakeholders connect with the bigger picture.

You Will:

Be a creative problem solver, resourceful in getting things done, and productive when working independently or collaboratively. Our Data Analysts are passionate about helping our Client’s use data to develop a multi-view of their customer and deliver improvements across the customer journey to achieve competitive advantage and amazing customer experiences. You would take on the following responsibilities:
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Gather and process raw data at scale (including writing ETL scripts, calling APIs, writing SQL queries, etc.)
Creative analytical mindset with the ability to think ‘outside of the box’
Develop key reports, dashboards and presentation decks on measure KPI performances for numerous clients across the digital industry.
Provide key insights to optimize ROI performance and identify learnings for future ROI
Support business decisions with ad hoc analysis as needed.
Technical Requirements:
A degree in the fields of Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Digital Marketing
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, analyze, and present the information with attention to detail and accuracy for reporting and communications. Prior experience in consulting is a bonus.
Certified in Google analytics (required) / Adobe analytics (preferred)
Understand the MarTech landscape and expertise in the main channels of online acquisition; Advertising (Search Engines, SEO, SEM, Bid-management Tools, AdExchange etc), Marketing (Display, Content, Email etc), Social Media (Facebook, Twitter, YouTube etc), eCommerce and optimisation (A/B testing tools).
2+ years working knowledge in BigQuery or any other SQL instances
2+ years working knowledge in Python/R covering libraries used in data cleansing/transformation, statistical programming, data visualizations and APIs
Working knowledge in BI/Visualization tools such as Data studio/ Power BI/ Tableau is beneficial.
Google Sheet + Google Apps Script or Excel + VBScript experience preferred, particularly for data manipulation / cleansing.
Understanding of cloud architecture, e.g. GCP/ AWS will be beneficial.
Fluent in English. Knowledge of a second language language (such as Mandarin, Cantonese, Vietnamese, Bahasa) is preferred

Corporate culture and guiding principles:
TP ICAP is a global firm of professional intermediaries that plays a pivotal role in the world’s financial, energy and commodities markets.
Operating through our core businesses; Tullett Prebon, ICAP, PVM, Mirexa Capital, Tullett Prebon Information, ICAP Information Services and PVM Data Services, we create strong networks in person and through technology. We provide comprehensive analysis and insight into market conditions and long-term trends. We combine data, knowledge and intelligence into contextual insight and commercial guidance. By engaging with our clients, and providing innovative products and services, we enable our clients to transact with confidence, facilitating the flow of capital and commodities around the world, enhancing investment and contributing to economic growth.
We are known in the market for our Honesty, Integrity, and Excellence in the provision of service to our clients. Above all else, we Respect our clients and each other, without bias. Roles & Responsibilities
Who We Are
Holistics makes it easy for both data and business teams to model and analyze their company data. We support over 200 fast-growing tech companies, including unicorns, across 30 countries. Our platform processes over 5 million analytics queries every month for over 5000 users globally.
Holistics Datasets help business teams understand and explore the data available for them to build their own reports without over-relying on their data team.
These datasets are built from Holistics Data Models, that simplifies work processes and reduces unnecessary repetitive work for data teams.
About This Role
You will take calls with prospects around the world to assess if Holistics can address their analytics use-cases.
You will be both the product expert, and work with our customers to help them get business value from using Holistics by onboarding them successfully.
This requires a good mix of technical acumen, problem discovery skills, and the ability to frame Holistics in a positive light.
Your Background
We're looking for people who are hungry to learn.
You should be proficient with SQL.

Knowledge of the data space isn't necessary; we are happy to teach you about the ins and outs of the current landscape. (We wrote an acclaimed book about this, so we know what we're talking about!)

That said, it is a plus if you have some experiences in the data world. For instance, you could have worked as:

SQL Data Analyst or Data Engineer where you have experience working on analytics requests from the business
Customer-facing Business Operations, where you have experience using data to inform and automate business processes
B2B Sales Engineer or Customer Success with a strong technical analytics skills
B2B Sales Rep with technical aptitude to sell technical analytics products
Any other background that fulfills the requirements below
Core Responsibilities
Your core responsibilities will be to front interactions with the market, and help to share new market insights internally to help with inform our company's strategic decisions. This includes:
Taking discovery video calls with prospects and customers around the world
Providing software walk-through demos and technical onboarding session
Updating CRM and meeting notes after the calls
Team Responsibilities
You will be part of the growth team who's responsible to help customers evaluate, buy, and remain with Holistics. Besides your core responsibilities, you will also be helping to contribute to several cross-functional functional team areas
Customer Service Duty: We rotate customer service duty across the entire growth team to help
Docs Squad: Help the team contribute to public docs and guides to help answer commonly asked questions at scale.
Pre-Sales: Help your colleagues address questions related to analytics or product use-cases
Insights team: Conduct joint win-review and customer success calls with the marketing insights team
Requirements
Strong SQL skills for data analytics purposes. This is really important to us! We expect you to be able to use our product, and to conduct fairly technical demos with prospective customers. This demands some proficiency with SQL. We are willing to train you if your SQL is rusty (tell us during the interview!), but we do expect you to be willing to pick up SQL, and willing to write complex queries for breakfast.
Enough technical acumen to understand concepts and trends in the data space. We'll educate you on developments in data and the broader 'analytics engineering' landscape, but you should be willing to learn about the entire industry!
Excellent active listening and conversational skills
Strong problem discovery and framing skills
Strong communication and documentation/instructional writing skills
Good-to-have: Experience with Git would be nice! We are working on several features that integrate with Git. If you don't have experience with Git, then we expect that you are willing to learn Git as part of the job. (And, again, we'll teach you).
Remote Work: Ability to work remotely, and keep the team updated on your progress
Ability to plan and set aside scheduled time-slots to cater for calls in US time-zones (this time will be considered as part of your total working hours). We currently operate in Asia but service multiple customers in the US and Europe. This means that team members often have to take calls at night, in order to fit into our customers's schedules. You'll expect to share in such responsibilities.
Learning more about Holistics
We have published a guidebook for data teams on how to set up the modern analytics stack in the cloud:
https://www.holistics.io/books/setup-analytics/
If you like to understand more about our platform, you can check out our docs here: https://docs.holistics.io
Holistics is the creator of the following tools and standards:
dbdiagrams.io
dbdocs.io
dbml.org
Why Join Holistics?
Leverage your current expertise: Gain frontline market interaction exposure with data teams around the world
Great product: Be associated with a software is ranked #2 globally for software usability by Gartner Frontrunner for business intelligence across over 280 BI tools.
Revenue funded: Holistics is fully funded by customer revenue, and we are accountable to our customers. Some of our major customers include some of the top tech unicorns around the world.
Sustainable: As a company, we are capital efficient, profitable, and have a good cash buffer. So we are sustainable from the unit economics perspective.
Strong Product Vision: We have a clear product vision towards serving the analytics engineering niche (Analytics as-code, API-first),

Seeking an incumbent who has experience in data quality management, information architecture and governance design and application and deployment of data policies and process.

Job Description
• Participate in the application and deployment of data policies and processes and its continued enforcement to include areas such as workflow for data ingestion, data quality, master data, and data life cycle management
• Ensure that data quality guidance and direction is applied throughout the entire data lifecycle, most importantly upfront, through the vision and roadmaps for solutions that seek to leverage data and data services
• Build and maintain a detailed audit of the organization's core systems and information assets that are held in these systems, as well as the teams and processes that use them
• Ensure that all data assets which are subject to the governance processes within the Data office are addressed
• Support the development and maintenance of an end-to-end data lifecycle management approach
• Apply data governance framework including the management of data, operating model, data policies, and standards as well as the application of clearly defined data management definitions for use across the organization
• Apply a data governance framework, with a focus on continuous improvement of data quality and strict adherence to the data classification processes.
• Follow the guidelines related to data governance and data quality and ensure clear accountability. Work with various stakeholders across the organization to achieve the goals defined in the data governance and data management strategies
• Follow standards, policies, and processes regarding data quality management
• Operate data remediation plans where data fails to meet the required standard

Job Requirements
• Relevant work experience in data quality management, information architecture, and governance design and implementation will be a plus
• Able to build cross-functional relationships that result in the adoption of organizational change
• Any data governance and IT certification is preferred not mandatory.
• At least 3 years of working experience in a relevant role

Roles & Responsibilities
About Standard Chartered
We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.
To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and Never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good.
We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base.

SC Ventures (“SCV”) was established in March of 2018 with the purpose of “Rewiring the DNA in Banking” by bringing three distinct areas together:
The eXellerator labs, enabling innovation at large in the Bank by supporting:
Entrepreneurially-minded colleagues as “Intrapreneurs”, developing ideas to products, services or new business models.
Collaboration with fintech companies, supported by the SC Ventures FintechBridge[1], Proof of Concept (“POC”) framework and POC funding.
Client engagement on co-creation activities.
The Innovation Investment Fund (“Fund”), USD100m allocated to acquire minority stakes in fintech companies (“fintechs”) whose technology has been successfully validated in the Group and is progressing to production (i.e., continuing use), subject to commercial due diligence.
Venture building, exploring new business models (“ventures”), with the objective of providing ‘optionality’ for the Group in the way it engages existing and new customers and markets. These adopt a start-up model, operating independently of the Group’s existing businesses, funded in a venture capital fashion, and under a different governance and risk management framework.
There are c.65 team members (excluding individual ventures), including dedicated colleagues from the Group’s support functions, based in Singapore, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Nairobi, London and San Francisco.
Key Roles and Responsibilities
The Venture is a newly formed fintech based in Singapore.
The successful candidate will be the part of a start-up team leading developers to build an innovative platform and app leveraging on data, analytics to drive the business. This is a rare opportunity for a self-driven, strong entrepreneurial spirit, start-up minded, solid and passionate individual to participate and contribute to a venture.
• Perform full lifecycle of data analyst / data science activities, including conceptualizing to operationalization.
• Provide critical thinking to look at numbers, trends, and data and come to correct conclusions based on the findings.

• Work with various people from the tech and marketing teams in meeting milestones, timelines, and deliverables for projects.

• Define data sources and specifications, design and implement processes and models for complex, large-scale datasets used for predictive modelling, data mining, and research purposes.

• Use Data Science or Data Analytics tools to design analytics dashboards. Develop dashboard visualization, metrics, insights; establishing baselines, targets, averages and benchmarks
• Ensure data quality and integrity
Knowledge and Qualifications
• Background in Statistics, Information Technology, Business Analytics, Data Science, Computing or related quantitative discipline.
• Good knowledge and experience with visualisation tools such as AWS QuickSight, Qlikview, Power BI, Tableau; and data science tools such as R, Python, Jupyter, AWS Sagemaker
• Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases
• Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Spark etc is a plus
• Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modelling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc.
• Deep expertise in common data science tools/package (sklearn, mllib, tensorflow, torch, etc.) is a plus.
• Good knowledge of data warehousing, data lake, data mining, advanced data analytics & modelling
• 5 years of relevant working experience, having implemented at least 2 major data warehouses / datamarts, data analytics, business intelligence or data science projects
• Methodical, process oriented, organised and proactive self-starter
• Able to work well within a team with diverse personalities
• Able to multi-task, quick to adapt and able to work in fast paced environment. Having worked in an agile environment is a plus.
• Good written and spoken communication, presentation and negotiation skills

company: DOW JONES AER COMPANY, INC. (SINGAPORE BRANCH)
job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Availability: Immediate
3 months contract (May to August)

The Dow Jones Data Strategy Group collects and integrates proprietary data and third-party licensed content, processing more than 500,000 articles a day from more than 35,000 news and business sources in 26 languages. Data Strategy also provides equity exchange data from 43 countries and creates content on markets, companies and people to help users identify business opportunities and manage risk.
We are looking for temporary Data Analysts to be attached to Data Strategy’s Risk & Compliance (R&C) Managed Services team, leveraging our market-leading research expertise and methodologies, to assist organisations with data-related projects, providing value-added services to deliver projects on time and within budget. Training will be provided on the job. This job requires individuals to work at the client’s premise of Dow Jones.

Job Summary
The role of the Data Analyst is to perform Anti-money Laundering (AML) risk-based review and analysis on individual and business accounts who match with Dow Jones Sanctions, Politically Exposed Persons and Adverse Media lists and adjudicate alerts accordingly for further review.
This role performs watch list screening for name matching, utilizing an understanding of Bank AML and OFAC regulatory policies and procedures.
There is a high degree of responsibility attached to this role as the role holder will be responsible for disposition of name screening escalations and accurately resolve matches identified.
The Job also requires the ability to consolidate multiple data sets from different sources and analyse the data accurately and efficiently. When processing data, it is crucial that the person is able to identify problems as they arise and provide appropriate solutions in a timely manner.
Responsible for ensuring accurate, complete and up-to-date internal documentation as well as client-facing material related to R&C Managed Services.
A professional attitude will be necessary as the Data Analyst will be exposed to client facing environments when working on-site at client offices.

Knowledge/Skills/Experience Required
Education up to bachelor degree.
Fluency in English and Chinese language is essential.
Familiar with AML typologies, any experience with name (or transaction) screening in the banking environment is highly preferred.
Hands-on experience working with large datasets, including statistical analyses, data visualization, data mining, and data cleansing/transformation will be helpful.
Experience with conducting data collection and analysis using Excel will be helpful
Experience with Factiva, Dow Jones Risk and Compliance (or similar products) are considered an advantage.
A fast, efficient and quality-focused work ethic.
Customer-focused: putting the customer first responding with a sense of urgency.
Adaptability and willingness to learn new skills.
Strong research skills, including online search tools. Tenacity and ingenuity in the pursuit of sources and information.
Ability to work as part of a multicultural team, to build and maintain good working relationships.
Flexible team player with a high level of initiative and self-motivation

Roles & Responsibilities
As a Data Engineer you will:
Perform data extraction, cleaning, transformation, and flow. Web scraping may be also a part of the work scope in data extraction.
Design, build, launch and maintain efficient and reliable large-scale batch and real-time data pipelines with data processing frameworks
Collaborate with Project Manager, Visualisation Developer, Data Scientist, UX Designers and Data Analyst to build scalable data-driven products
Work in an Agile Environment that practices Continuous Integration and Delivery
Support and advise best practices in data management standards, policies and procedures
Work closely with fellow developers through pair programming and code review process
Integrate and collate data silos in a manner which is both scalable and compliant
Be responsible for developing backend APIs & working on databases to support the applications

EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS NEEDED
Interest in being the bridge between engineering and analytics
Knowledge about system design, data structure and algorithms
Familiar with data modelling, data access, and data storage infrastructure like Data Mart, Data Lake, and Data Warehouse
Proficient in general data cleaning and transformation (e.g. SQL, pandas, R, etc)
Familiar with rest API and web requests/protocols in general
Proficient with processing data from open-standard file format or data interchange format (e.g. XML, JSON)
Comfortable in both windows and Linux development environments
Proficient in building ETL pipeline (eg. Talend Data Integration, Informatica PowerCenter, IBM DataStage, SAS Data Integration)
Proficient in database design and various databases (e.g. MS SQL Server, Oracle RDBMS, IBM DB2, Postgres etc)
Comfortable in at least one scripting language (eg. Python)
Experience with building production-grade data pipelines, ETL/ELT data integration
Demonstrate proficiency in shell scripting

As part of Keyrus’ solution delivery, we are also in a position to recruit and place technical consultants to complement on existing client projects with their expertise. As such, we seek innovative and agile people to support ambitious and forthcoming technological challenges.

Using statistical tools to interpret data sets, paying particular attention to trends and patterns that could be valuable for diagnostic and predictive analytics efforts.
Demonstrating the significance of their work in the context of local, national, and global trends that impact both their organization and industry.

Who We Are
Chinsay is a SaaS platform for the end-to-end management of contracts in the global commodities and freight markets – multi-trillion-dollar industries. We were, and remain, pioneers in designing and building software for collaborative contract management. The space we occupy has some of the world’s largest companies, dealing with highly complex problems that are largely managed with centuries old workflows. You will work alongside our team of industry insiders and passionate technologists to deliver solutions that tame complexity and make the old way of doing things obsolete.
Chinsay is transforming the perception of what a contract is and how it can be used to drive value to all areas of an organization. We are front and centre in the movement to digitize trade documentation and facilitate digital supply chains.
We have ambitious plans for our technology and we seek passionate people with skill and tenacity to join our team and help us deliver our vision.
Engineering at Chinsay
Our technology is our business and it is very important to Chinsay to have a highly skilled and motivated engineering team. We practice modern and agile ways of developing software and always evaluate how we work, how we can improve and how we can be happy doing it. Retrospectives, one-on-ones, and reviews are a natural part of our work.
Pair programming and TDD are highly encouraged and used to a great extent, though it is up to the developers and teams to organize as they want to get the best results.
To keep our skills sharp and current, we do regular coding gatherings. We have team learning (and team fun) events, and all developers have a personal budget for education. We expect a lot from our engineers and we will provide you the resources and engaged support you need to do the best work of your career in a company you will love.

job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About PwC

A career at PwC is more than “just” a job. It’s about being part of a purpose-led firm that builds trust in society and solve important problems. We help our clients to make informed decisions and operate effectively within them. At PwC, we are committed to making a difference for each other, our clients, and our community — by empowering you to be the best version of yourself and investing in your growth. You’ll be able to develop as a leader, be well-connected, work in a great environment, explore our benefits and make a positive contribution.

With PwC, you’ll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a strong coaching and people-oriented culture, our Flex policies (Flex Space, Flex Dress and Flex Time), innovative learning and development programs (training programs, digital upscaling) as well as mobility opportunities. If you would like to be connected to like-minded individuals outside of work, we highly encourage you to be part of our people clubs and committees such as the Sports and Recreational Club, Toastmasters Club and more

How will you value-add?

A highly matured and independent individual responsible for performing analytics with learning data to generate insights on effectiveness of learning strategies, measure learning ROI, and propose learning solutions and design.

This individual will work cohesively with various client stakeholder groups across PwC, and display strong interpersonal and organizational skills, as well as business acumen.
Additionally, this individual will:
Collaborate with learning stakeholders on issue statements, and thereafter determine, design, propose and present data-validated solutions
Design data workflow for seamless data collection and reporting process
Prepare reports and create data visualisation dashboards for executive leadership that effectively communicate learning & development trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data
Collaborate with programmers and organizational leaders to identify opportunities for process improvements, recommend system modifications, and develop policies for data governance.
Liaise with Global/Regional L&D and HR teams to introduce data solution and digital initiatives locally
Support any ad-hoc projects as may be required or assigned
About you

What we need to see in you:
Degree in Computer Science / Information Technology or its equivalent
Minimum 5 years of relevant work experience in the L&D environment and possess good data analytics skills
Certification in Alteryx, PowerBI, Tableau, Qlikview or UIPath preferred
A critical thinker with strong analytical and problem solving skills
Strong interpersonal and communication skills with ability to understand and communicate business needs
A team player with a high level of agility

Roles & Responsibilities
Corporate culture and guiding principles:
TP ICAP is a global firm of professional intermediaries that plays a pivotal role in the world’s financial, energy and commodities markets.
Operating through our core businesses; Tullett Prebon, ICAP, PVM, Mirexa Capital, Tullett Prebon Information, ICAP Information Services and PVM Data Services, we create strong networks in person and through technology. We provide comprehensive analysis and insight into market conditions and long-term trends. We combine data, knowledge and intelligence into contextual insight and commercial guidance. By engaging with our clients, and providing innovative products and services, we enable our clients to transact with confidence, facilitating the flow of capital and commodities around the world, enhancing investment and contributing to economic growth.
We are known in the market for our Honesty, Integrity, and Excellence in the provision of service to our clients. Above all else, we Respect our clients and each other, without bias. Employees are expected to uphold the values and principles of our cultural framework in performance of their job duties.
Job Summary:
The successful candidate will support the Operations Data Manager and be responsible for supporting the delivery of specific project related data activities, both with regards to initial data analytics and investigation, and subsequent data management.
Service coverage will include:
Data analytics, across our Client, Trader and Broker databases, supporting the transition of certain data points, between databases
Operational Data management both within core Operations data and ancillary front end systems.

Analysing source data (Client, Trader and Broker) against target database, to determine matches
Engaging with our partners to interrogate the “mapping breaks” to conclude best matches
Execution of subsequent Data stewardship responsibilities, to ensure that we maintain high quality, clean data by adhering to a strict governance and controls framework

Supporting the BAU Operational Data Team, with the manual update of any data points that cannot be automated/scripted, ensuring the integrity of the data at all times.

Must be legally eligible to work in the relevant region.

Demonstrable experience/ knowledge of data-oriented processes, across multiple sources and systems.
Experience of operational workflows and how data is used and maintained through the trade lifecycle.

· Coordinate with central PCL on SAP projects

Job Requirement
· Diploma in Supply Chain / IT / Business or equivalent
· Good interpersonal skills to handle/ resolve suppliers matters

· Proficient in SAP module (MM & BOM)
· Able to work under pressure and prioritize task efficiently
· Proficient in Microsoft Office (Excel, Words, Powerpoint)
· EDI Knowledge

Roles & Responsibilities
Job Purpose
- Role is a Data Governance Specialist to support the data management practice of the Bank’s Risk Management Group (RMG)
- Primary role is to assist with the execution in Risk Management Group (RMG) of the 4 pillars of the Bank’s Data Governance Model, which are:
Data Ownership, Data Discoverability, Data Quality and Data Access.
And also taking lead roles in some Data Management related exercises (e.g. Data Ingestion projects).

Key Accountabilities
1. Ensure issues in the RMG Data Quality Log are properly followed up, status reported and resolved within expected timelines.
2. Ensure Critical Data Attributes have Date Quality monitoring in place.
3. Ensure RMG owned data has complete and proper business metadata in place
4. Ensure RMG data has identified owners.
5. Ensure Data users to have proper data access timely.
6. Ensure annual review of BCBS239 reports are properly facilitated among RMG units and overseas locations, and information are kept up to date in the metadata documentation system.

Job Duties & responsibilities
1. Involved in organizing the Monthly Data Quality forum including preparation of meeting material.
2. Organize cross-department discussion to resolve data quality issues.
3. Work with RMG stakeholders on setting up data quality monitoring reports and review process.
4. Review and prepare business metadata for Data Ingestion exercises.
5. Participate in data ownership discussion and follow-ups.
6. Assist in review and setup of the data access for users.
7. Drive data management related exercise, such as annual review of BCBS239 reports.

job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Seeking an incumbent who has experience in data quality management, information architecture and governance design and application and deployment of data policies and process.

Job Description
• Participate in the application and deployment of data policies and processes and its continued enforcement to include areas such as workflow for data ingestion, data quality, master data, and data life cycle management
• Ensure that data quality guidance and direction is applied throughout the entire data lifecycle, most importantly upfront, through the vision and roadmaps for solutions that seek to leverage data and data services
• Build and maintain a detailed audit of the organization's core systems and information assets that are held in these systems, as well as the teams and processes that use them
• Ensure that all data assets which are subject to the governance processes within the Data office are addressed
• Support the development and maintenance of an end-to-end data lifecycle management approach
• Apply data governance framework including the management of data, operating model, data policies, and standards as well as the application of clearly defined data management definitions for use across the organization
• Apply a data governance framework, with a focus on continuous improvement of data quality and strict adherence to the data classification processes.
• Follow the guidelines related to data governance and data quality and ensure clear accountability. Work with various stakeholders across the organization to achieve the goals defined in the data governance and data management strategies
• Follow standards, policies, and processes regarding data quality management
• Operate data remediation plans where data fails to meet the required standard

Job Requirements
• Relevant work experience in data quality management, information architecture, and governance design and implementation will be a plus
• Able to build cross-functional relationships that result in the adoption of organizational change
• Any data governance and IT certification is preferred not mandatory.
• At least 3 years of working experience in a relevant role

Roles & Responsibilities
The Role
We are seeking a Senior Data Analyst with 2-4 years’ experience working for a multi-national enterprise, utilizing multi-datasets and sources, and running predictive and prescriptive analytics for all channels of the business. Your role is to develop accurate, timely, relevant, and quality analytics tools for a dynamic business.
You will be reporting to Analytics Director and own multiple modules of analytics project development. You will be working hands-on, delivering flexible solutions, and ensuring stakeholder satisfaction.

As Senior Data Analyst, you will be responsible for:
• Advanced analytics development, from data DTL, to analytics model development, to visualization dashboard building
• Supporting development and testing of hypotheses across all functional datasets supplied by business
• Developing and implementing algorithms that will substantially impact the company’s understanding and utilization of its data
• Supporting proof of concept, and development of analytics tools and applications
• Liaising both internally within the team and externally with business stakeholders for completion of analytics project delivery
• Coaching and guiding interns technically to ensure timely and quality completion of assigned tasks

Roles & Responsibilities
Looking for hands-on, motivated self-starters who are driven to leverage on the power of using data to drive informed business decisions for an Asian Ecommerce giant.

The role involves constantly solving problems and introducing innovative solutions to improve platform usability and enhance end user experience for buyers, sellers, and partners. You will collaborate with various departments to manage end-to-end e-commerce processes, and design scalable solutions to drive strategic initiatives to sharpen policy, processes and features for greater product and operational excellence. Have a chance to work in Operations teams such as Customer Service, Payment, Listings, Seller Operations etc.

Responsibilities
Deep dive into data to investigate trends, uncover insights, and explore new opportunities for our business growth.
Create data reports, visualisations, and meaningful analyses to support our business teams in making data-driven decisions.
Partner with internal stakeholders from cross-functional and products teams to capture business requirements, shape data, and set up processes to design and build reporting solutions.
Identify gaps and pioneer new ways to optimise our processes and improve data integrity.
Sharpen your skills continuously by staying up-to-date with existing and emerging business intelligence tools
Your abilities:
Strong interest to work with large data sets
Eagerness to make an impact with data-driven solutions
Degree in Mathematics/Statistics/Computer Science and related subjects
Strong knowledge in Data Manipulation/Warngling, Analytics, Statistics etc
Strong foundation in data query/manipulation (e.g. SQL, Python) and Big Data technologies (e.g. Spark, PySpark)
Excellent communication and presentation skills to present insights clearly to different stakeholders
Ability to thrive in a fast paced and collaborative environment

Roles & Responsibilities
· Preferably has experience from the industry in genomics and bioinformatics, preferably from a company engaged in the microbiome and/or genetic testing and reporting for lifestyle and disease conditions.
· Should have competencies and hands-on experience with NGS data analysis and bioinformatics tools (assembly, SNPs, variant calling, metagenomics, etc.).
· Experience in R and Python scripting.
· Comfortable working with LINUX / UNIX computing platforms.
· Solid experience in data mining and review of medical, bioinformatics, and genomics literature.
· Experience working with a multidisciplinary team and have worked closely with a Genomics team in data analysis and report generation.
Experience in Machine Learning methods and their implementation would be an added advantage
· Develop and/or apply innovative computational methods to analyze multi-scale omics data.
· Collaborating with cross-functional teams to find opportunities to support biomarker discovery by analyzing external and internal microbiome and genetic data.
· Responsible for developing a framework for developing a Genetic Risk Scoring method for specific conditions.
· Coordinate with the IT team to automate the risk scoring and also Genetic test result reporting.
· Continuous improvement of the framework by adding new markers and progress in the scoring methods based on scientific advances.
· Scientific literature writing and paper publishing, blogs, writing for popular journals and other publications, attending and representing the company in seminars and scientific forums.
· Handle customer responses on genetic testing results and interpretations.
· Maintenance of an excellent publication record.
· Regular presentation at internal and external meetings to audiences of diverse scientific backgrounds.

Roles and Responsibilities
The candidate shall be responsible for the application of machine learning techniques and data science-related technology in the area of predictive maintenance for various vehicular systems.

Roles & Responsibilities
About Standard Chartered
We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.
To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and Never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good.
We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base.

The Role Responsibilities
Perform the Product Owner role as part of the Agile delivery team; responsible for maximizing the business value of the product and be accountable for successful delivery.
Creating and maintaining a prioritized Product Backlog
Eliciting requirements from front facing staff & stakeholders across various business segments, product lines and functions.
Work with Business Strategy/COO teams in defining metrics, data requirements, calculation methodology for managing the scorecards for front line staff.
Mange scorecard life cycle as a BAU process.
Identify & Source the data from the golden source systems to Data lake and performing transformations, data quality rules etc via tools like Dataiku.
Clearly communicating priorities, sprint goals and acceptance criteria to the scrum team.
Defining user stories to facilitate clear communication of requirements to the scrum team, including 'definition of done'.
Act as a key player in the different events of the development cycle: daily scrums, team demos and retrospectives, SIT, UAT and sign-off from business stakeholders.
Review test cases and evidence to ensure enough test coverage.
Inspect the product progress at the end of every Sprint and accept or reject work done
Contribute to continuous improvement with business feedback/vision (covered during the retrospective)
Remain aware of the daily BAU activities to maintain a grasp on business/process evolution
Facilitate and drive our business / data analyst groups to brainstorm new ideas.
Conduct research to see what's new and trending in the digital / data space internally and externally
Ensuring submission of progress reports, benefits reports, red packs and closure reports to governance forums
Responsible for tracking benefits realization and adoption on an ongoing basis.
Refining the vision/strategy and drive 'our digital / data journey'
Our Ideal Candidate
Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Computer or equivalent required; Master’s Degree is a plus
Minimum of 10 years of Banking industry work experience in large-scale projects/programs with significant change impact and multiple dependencies within and across organizational boundaries.
Ability to simultaneously execute multiple roles individually, including SCRUM Product Owner, SCRUM Master, PM/Business Analyst, Data Analyst.
Proven track record in delivering projects successfully from inception to delivery through Agile methodology - ideally as a Product Owner with Good planning and forward-thinking skills.
Strong stakeholder management ability in handling wide-ranging requests from senior stakeholders.
Capable and reliable in meeting tight schedules and deadlines as well as high attention to detail while maintaining clear customer expectations throughout the life cycle of a project/engagement.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Good organizational and documentation skills are essential.
Understanding of wholesale banking products and banks operational model. Understanding of individual scorecards for frontline staff with prior experience in implementing scorecards by working together with Business Strategy/COO teams in defining metric, calculation methodology, identifying & sourcing the data from the golden source systems, setting up BAU process to manage the scorecard life cycle etc.
Basic Project Management: Knowledge of project management principles and the ability to apply the principles, tools and techniques to develop/plan, manage or execute projects or work plans to ensure successful completion (e.g., on time, within budget).
Familiarity with project management tools such as JIRA, Confluence and Trello.
Understanding and appreciation of the technical / business considerations involved with digital initiatives within banks, including; infrastructure, security, integration etc
Preferred
Prior experience in delivering Business process automation solutions using PEGA platform.
Prior experience in managing scorecard for front line staff as a BAU process
Strong data skillset, including SQL query building and/or BI analytics
Hands on experience with Data analytics and Visualization tools
Knowledge of Data Quality Management Framework within Banks/financial institutions
PEGA Business Architect certification or higher.
SCRUM - Product Owner and/or SCRUM - Scrum Master certification.

Novelship is seeking a Backend Engineer to join our Product Research team.

The Backend Engineer will be responsible for the building and maintaining specialised tools for automation, data aggregation from multiple sources, data analysis and reporting supporting the business and customer needs.

In this role you will:
Work closely with Data Analyst to translate team’s data needs into technical design elements.
Design, develop, validate and deploy of critical automation features
Working directly on engineering problems to identify root causes and develop solutions in a timely manner.
Troubleshoot automation coding/scripting and system integration issues efficiently and effectively
Research new technology, architectures, frameworks, and products to be incorporated into the current or future automation suit

Familiar with Python and Javascript (Nodejs). Proficient in at least one.

Detail-oriented and methodological in approach to tasks
Collaborative worker and good communicator
Excellent time-management skills

Awareness about Sneakers & Apparels is a Bonus

Who we are?
Novelship is Asia Pacific's growing marketplace for authentic sneakers. We look to make available to this region the most exclusive kicks around the World. Buy and sell authentic sneakers through the platform and join us to change the landscape together.

Roles & Responsibilities
SIA-NUS Digital Aviation Lab at the National University of Singapore (NUS) offers an exciting opportunity for a highly motivated User Experience Design Researcher in Work Package 4. The work package focuses on developing innovations in the following key strategic areas related to passengers’ inflight experience, mainly in Enhancements to SIA’s Cabin Seat Product Offerings, Novel Features for SIA’s Next Generation Aircraft Cabins for Sleep Improvement and Pushing SIA’s Superior Customer Experience to New Heights with an Advanced Connected Cabin.
The duties and responsibilities for this role includes developing and executing strategies to deliver the 3 phases described in Project 4 and collaborating with other team members (which includes Software Engineers, Hardware Engineers, Data Analyst and Industrial Designer) in the WP and the Corp Lab to identify user pain points by leveraging on data analytics, design, qualitative and quantitative method to identified critical business needs.
As a UX researcher and designer, you will also be responsible to develop design solutions and concepts from the research data.
Requirements
The University values courage and creativity, openness and engagement, inclusion and diversity, and respect and integrity. As such, we see the importance of recruiting talent aligned to these values and are looking for a User Experience Design Researcher who has:
Bachelor’s Degree in Industrial Design, Design, Anthropology, Psychology, Sociology or related disciplines
Possess good interpersonal skills
Ability to plan, manage and conduct research using both qualitative and quantitative processes and methods
UI/UX experience will be a plus
Proficient with UI/UX software such as Figma, Adobe XD.
Good writing and presentation skills.
“A sound ability to scope a research process, lead fieldwork, conduct interviews and do desk research.
Ability to synthesize research findings, uncover and articulate insights that will inform and inspire design.
High comfort level in working within a self-directed culture and navigating ambiguity.
Openness to critique from other disciplines and curiosity to learn from a spectrum of perspectives.
An empathy and curiosity for how great brands, businesses and organizations navigate innovation and design.
Experience with unique and novel tools and methods to uncover key insights
Fluency in quantitative research methods. Ability to create and analyse surveys to impact design.

Roles & Responsibilities
Star Information Systems has proudly served the maritime industry for more than 20 years. Since the company was founded, STAR has strived to deliver state of the art software solutions for ship and rig management, and we are continuously improving our systems as well as developing new software to meet the high demands of the shipping and offshore industries.

We are currently looking to expand our Analytics team in Singapore with Data Analysts.

As STAR’s Data Analyst, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining STAR Analytics.
STAR Analytics is designed to provide the customer with necessary and correlated information from the various elements of the STAR Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) suite.
The position will cover the entire process from business requirements to delivery and work closely with EAM Program/ Product Managers and EAM System Analysts

Responsibilities
Translate business requirement to visualization and analytics for data-driven decision making.
Develop and execute database queries for ETL implementation.
Create visualizations and reports with Power BI and Crystal Reports.
Analyze data models and dependencies to optimize performance.
Performing tests to ensure data accuracy and technical correctness together with the product owners.
Deploy STAR Analytics to our customers.
Develop and update technical documentation.

Requirements
Experience in utilizing ETL tools, including SSIS, DTS and Data Stage and ETL Package design.
Experience in SSAS (SQL Server Analysis Services).
Experience in complete database Administration.
In-depth understanding of database management systems (SQL Server).
Strong data analysis skills.
Strong knowledge of Power BI and Crystal Reports.
Minimal 2 to 3 years of experience in datawarehouse development and visualizations.

Soft Skills
Open-minded, willing to learn, proactive.

Education
(Bachelors) Degree in IT/Computer Science/Computer Engineering or relevant discipline.

Working language
English, with proficiency.

We offer
Flexible hours.
Competitive compensation.
Technically engaged coworkers.
A focused, relaxed and supportive environment.
International experience and a collaborative environment.

Apply for the position

Alexander Ramaker (Operations Manager), ar@sismarine.com.

Roles & Responsibilities
As the Insights Manager you’ll help the consumer and marketing teams to understand the user even better. Your expertise and contributions will help them improve existing and continue building user-focused products that improve their lives. Your role will provide invaluable insights about what motivates the consumers, why they behave the way they do and their sentiment towards products, brands and communications.

You’re a data-driven storyteller! You don’t just stop at numbers and graphs but are able to translate numbers into actionable business insights and recommendations. You’re able to captivate a range of stakeholders from various disciples to bring about positive shifts in the way the brand interacts with users, creators and public media. Through your expertise, you’re able to navigate the client through noise to land on impactful results.

Ideally, you have covered projects for public relations, policies, brand reputation and marketing influencing the changing perceptions of users. You’re expected to have exceptional content presentation skills as you capture the audiences.

Role:
You’re a data storyteller by heart and able to translate insights into actionable business recommendations through compelling user stories and market dynamics.
You will work on projects covering highly regarded tech products in the market as you help to identify, translate and present the voice of the users through in-depth analysis and by deep diving into usage data.
You are a research enthusiast and a progressive, insightful and a natural fan of all things tech and marrying that with your passion for market research, insights, data analysis and science.
Beyond data and insights, you’re expected to help formulate brand, product, communications, language, creative and messaging suggestions, objectives and strategies.
You will help the wider insights, research and product marketing teams to better understand product usage and behaviors, brand’s health and reputation, as well as media impact and effectiveness.
You:
BA/BS/MA/MSc degree or equivalent practical experience.
10 years experience as a Research Manager, Insights Manager, Data Analyst or Data Scientist; ideally on technology client projects.
Ideally, you have experience with: Python, R, SQL, QlikSense, PowerBI, Tableau, or similar.
Significant experience in insights, data analytics and data science (client or agency-side), e.g. quantitative survey execution (questionnaire design/development, sampling/weighting, cross-tabulation), qualitative (co-creation, ethnography, group discussions, workshops) and marketing effectiveness.
Ability to work effectively cross-functionally and to make data and insights accessible and easily digestible to a non-expert audience.
Experience designing and supporting research projects to gain actionable business insights; directly or alongside creative agencies.
Experience liaising with third-party research agencies and complex, multi-country research studies.
A self-starter and independent thinker who is able to craft meaningful stories, insights and suggestions based on data.
Driven by an entrepreneurial environment, eager to take advantage of new technologies and data sources to create new and interesting ways to understand users.
Demonstrated technical expertise and knowledge of tech products and offerings.
Exceptional analytical, project and stakeholder management and presentation skills.
Exceptional verbal and written English communications skills and, ideally, fluent in another Asian language to support with projects spanning across APAC.

Please note: due to the high volume of applications, only successful candidates will be contacted with a follow up introduction email. If you do not receive an email from Maker Lab, your application has been unsuccessful this time around. Look out for future roles!

Roles & Responsibilities
Data Consultant
Salary up to SGD6700 a month

You must be based in Singapore currently to apply.

I'm partnering with the leading global data consultancy that is specializing in data analytics and advanced AI technology that help brands in APAC and across the world accelerate growth in digital commerce. They are expanding their team in Singapore and looking to hire a Data Analyst.

About the opportunity...

Your focus will be on supporting customers and internal product teams with data visualization and reporting and helping to join the dots between digital shelf intelligence and online retailer market share data. You will report to the Head of Solution in the Data Consulting and Analysis Department. This role will enable you to deliver significant value to global brands leveraging extensive expertise (7+ years experience in China and 10+ years‘ global experience).

Responsibilities...
Support the senior consulting and client management teams in Singapore to deliver insights and professional services to our customers.
Responsible for customer training & enablement – focussing on market share and digital shelf services.
Support the SEA/China-based Market Share center of excellence to adopt best practices across the region.
Advanced analysis to support customers’ key business decisions, including competitor analysis, business performance analysis, correlation analysis, and regression modeling.
Promoting the use of insight & research for business decision-making and continually monitoring changes in customer needs and how the business should react.
Leverage knowledge of the key digital commerce platforms to improve and optimize analytical frameworks.
Responsible for communicating to business customers with various levels of technical knowledge, educating them about our data solution, as well as sharing insights and recommendations.
To be successful in this role you’ll need…
Bachelor/Master’s degree in a business intelligence-related field such as Business Analytics, Operational Research, Machine Learning, Data Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Economics.
2+ years of experience in corporate insight/research functions, consulting background.
Fluency in using SQL or Python and Hands-on experience. Proficiency in Tableau/Power BI is preferred.
Fluent written and spoken English; Chinese would be an additional advantage.
Strong Analytical skills –Proof of delivering insights from quantitative (e.g. customer/market/financial) data, positively impacting brands’ business.
Familiar with different types of analysis, market sizing, competitive analysis.
Demonstrated ability to communicate complex technical problems in simple plain stories or present to a senior customer audience.

Interested? Please apply.

What You Do
The Business Data Analyst (Strategy Analytics & Intel) actively partners with BioPrcoessing Strategy consultants and business leaders across Process Solutions to source, align, cleanse and analyze data (both qualitative and quantitative) to provide meaningful and insightful views on our market. Through a highly collaborative approach, the Analyst advises and helps stakeholders develop their fact-based understanding of the market. The insights produced by the Analyst also inform portfolio management and the strategy development process.

Responsibilities
Lead Process Solutions, BioProcessing data sourcing and analysis
Sourcing, developing, cleansing and presenting external and internal data to assess markets and initiatives
Integrating disparate data sources (internal and external) to create a view on markets
Developing and maintaining dashboards to communicate data to stakeholders
Establishing, monitoring and reporting protocols based upon market movements
Exhibit strong teamwork within and beyond the BioProcessing Strategy group to drive functional success
Engage, mentor and challenge team members
Integrate tools and best practices into function
Build scalable capabilities in the business

Who You Are
Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Statistics, Applied Math, Data Science or in a related field with data analysis / data science certificate. Advanced degree in a quantitative field (MBA, Masters or PhD) would be advantageous
Management consulting, competitive intelligence and/or market intelligence experience ideally within Life Sciences, Pharmaceutical or Chemicals markets
5 years of relevant, professional experience
Proficiency with advanced data analytics and data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI)
Strong communication skills – data visualization, presentation creation
Deeply analytical with quantitative and qualitative data – framing and conducting analysis, market modeling
Experience with:
Structured Query Language (SQL), Relational Database Management Systems and Cloud Databases
Programming languages like Python, R, JavaScript, etc.
Statistical Programming packages such as R, SAS, SPSS
Ability to lead multiple complex projects involving technology development, many team members, and external collaborators
Experienced in global organization working with highly technical team members
Influences without authority and drives actionable results

Roles & Responsibilities
Who are We Looking For
We are seeking a Data Analyst with a proven track record of delivering impact and value to business through insights. Your work will influence business decisions that will drive the operations, customer engagement, stakeholder management and asset management of the organization across a wide range of industries and business use cases. You will work towards promoting and enabling a data-centric approach among internal stakeholders and ensure the proper metrics are being used in tracking and improving key business parameters. This role requires an inquisitive individual with an eye for detail and passion for numbers and how they influence business decisions. It is also important for you to have strong communication and collaborative skills in engaging stakeholders and be able to solve their pain points through the data insights you provide.
What will You Do
· Collaborate with stakeholders to obtain a clear understanding of their business pain points and develop the appropriate data products to support their business decisions
· Collate available data sources and evaluate definitions and limitations, before implementing ETL processes to build the relevant datasets
· Design and build data products and dashboards to enable stakeholders to visualize data insights, and train them to be able to derive the answers they seek themselves
· Define and create processes to ensure stakeholders can efficiently track key metrics on a regular frequency, depending on the business use case
· Work closely with technology vendors to develop and refine data products and coordinate with internal teams to enhance the quality and richness of the data lake
What will You Bring
· 2 to 5 years of experience in data analyst role, with a bachelor’s degree specialising in business analytics, preferably in a large organization with business units operating across different industries
· Proficient in data analytics tools, and possesses plenty of hands-on experience with data visualisation products
· Track record of delivering data products that cater to stakeholder requirements and making sure analysis and reports are fit for purpose
· Strong communication skills with the ability to articulate complex concepts in a simple and succinct manner
· Critical thinker and a creative problem solver; able to evaluate a problem across different facets and develop solutions that work
· Meticulous and conscientious in your approach to work, delivering high quality work that is error free
· Excellent time management and task prioritisation skills

company: THE GREAT EASTERN LIFE ASSURANCE COMPANY LIMITED
job_description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Purpose
The Business Intelligence & Viz team enables Great Eastern data practitioners with Data and Analytics platforms as Business owner of the platforms. The team manages the operating model of the platforms and the best practices that enable access to high quality data. Through the platforms, interactive dashboards and insights are used in supporting a wide range of strategic and operational business decisions. The team also provides business intelligence, data visualization and analytics support in Great Eastern.
The Data Analyst is responsible for ensuring the successful delivery of enterprise wide visual analytics initiatives. These initiatives typically include the development of best practice data visualizations and dashboards using appropriately aggregated data sources to derive business insights with a potential to drive business performance. The Visualization Data Analyst is expected to work closely with key stakeholders and possess the relevant technical skills required to implement analytics solutions that enable the use of data as a strategy.

The Job
· Design, build and enhance visual analytics assets to ensure continued relevance and usage of the dashboards by business users for making informed decisions.
· Support the build of contextual data marts where necessary to advance the scalability and reusability of visual analytics assets.
· Ensure all analytics project undertaking comply with both internal and external policies, guidelines and regulations.
· Support ad-hoc requests as and when required.
· Takes accountability in considering business and regulatory compliance risks and takes appropriate steps to mitigate the risks.
· Maintains awareness of industry trends on regulatory compliance, emerging threats and technologies in order to understand the risk and better safeguard the company.
· Highlights any potential concerns /risks and proactively shares best risk management practices.
Our Requirements
· Fluency in English, both written and spoken (fluency in other Asian languages is a plus).
· BS in Business Analytics, Statistics, Economics, Actuarial Science or equivalent disciplines that focuses on extensive use of data for analysis.
· 1 to 3 years of experience participating in business intelligence and analytics projects as an individual contributor required. Fresh graduates are welcome to apply.
· Experience in insurance or financial services industry is a plus.
· Working level competency in SQL programming and standard MS Office applications required.
· Experience in data visualization software such as Tableau is a must.
· High level of integrity, takes accountability of work and good attitude over teamwork.
· Takes initiative to improve current state of things and adaptable to embrace new changes.

To all recruitment agencies: Great Eastern does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our email or our employees. We will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Roles & Responsibilities
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo. Internal Audit and Risk Control team is missioned to be an independent and trusted gatekeeper and advisor through providing objective assurance, comprehensive evaluation, and proactively innovative consultancy on global employees integrity, business risk management and controls to protect and maximize organizational value for the Company, its investors, and stakeholders.

We are now looking for data analysts in Singapore/Los Angeles/London who will power our mission with data engineering, data analytics and data science technology.

Responsibilities:
- Analyze the company's business risk with data, locate key factors and generate key indicators out of the data and link to the process risks, develop and manage IARC data map and risk data warehouse.
- Integrate fragmented and scattered local information into effective indices or models with data mining, clustering, classification technologies, to form a set of parameters and rules that fully describes the risk levels of different risks along the business processes.
- Leverage data engineering and data science to provide analytical insights, contribute to and help deliver risk data mining, ETL, data warehouse construction, data cleaning/restructuring, statistical modeling and machine learning application in partnership with internal audit, risk control, investigation and other cross-functional teams.
- Participate in the development of Internal Audit and Risk Control data platform, deploy data cronjobs or monitoring models in ByteDance data platform. Design and develop BI dashboards to present the analytics insights and set anomaly alerts according to monitoring rules.

Qualifications
- Bachelor or Master degree in advanced field of technology or management or other equivalent majors such as mathematics, statistics, computer science, financial engineering, etc.
- 3+ years of strong industry experience in big data analysis and/or risk data modeling and/or other relevant data mining fronts. Data science(algorithms/machine learning) experience in large Internet companies are preferred.
- Proficiency in data analysis and statistical analysis tools such as SQL, R, and Python. Proficiency in data science skills and common Machine Learning application knowledge.
- Experience in coordinating cross-functional and cross-regional execution. Strong communication, critical thinking, internet related business acumen and quick learning is preferred.

Accredify is a well-funded Singapore based trust-tech start-up with presence in Malaysia, Myanmar, Japan and Vietnam. We help organisations turn physical documents into verifiable and tamper-proof documents by leveraging on distributed ledger technology. We are a fast-growing start-up with a work-hard/play-hard culture. If you would like to join our young and dynamic team, apply for this opportunity today!

In Education, we help higher education institutions issue tamper-proof digital degree certificates and transcripts. The firm is currently present in 5 countries and expanding their solution across the globe. In 2020, we were recognised as one of the Top 50 Southeast Asia EdTech firms by HolonIQ.

In Healthcare, Accredify is a government-authorised service provider that helps healthcare institutions issue HealthCerts, a template for digital verifiable COVID-19 swab results which Accredify helped to co-develop and is currently being issued by all clinics in Singapore. Accredify has 500 partner clinics in Singapore and Hong Kong.
